
Name: CVE-2016-9158
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161103)
Reference: BID:94820
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94820
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-731239.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-731239.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-16-348-05
Reference: SECTRACK:1037434
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037434

A vulnerability has been identified in SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family (All
versions), SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family (incl. related ET200 CPUs and
SIPLUS variants) (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 PN/DP V6 and below CPU
family (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 PN/DP V7
CPU family (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 V6
and earlier CPU family (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 V7 CPU family
(All versions). Specially crafted packets sent to port 80/tcp could
cause the affected devices to go into defect mode. A cold restart is
required to recover the system.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9159
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161103)
Reference: BID:94820
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94820
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-731239.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-731239.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-16-348-05
Reference: SECTRACK:1037434
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037434

A vulnerability has been identified in SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family (All
versions), SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family (incl. related ET200 CPUs and
SIPLUS variants) (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 PN/DP V6 and below CPU
family (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 PN/DP V7
CPU family (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 V6
and earlier CPU family (All versions), SIMATIC S7-400 V7 CPU family
(All versions), SIMATIC S7-410 V8 CPU family (All versions), SIMATIC
S7-410 V8 CPU family (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions). An
attacker with network access to port 102/tcp (ISO-TSAP) or via
Profibus could obtain credentials from the PLC if protection-level 2
is configured on the affected devices.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9178
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161104)
Reference: BID:94144
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94144
Reference: CONFIRM:http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c109fabbd51863475cd12ac206bdd249aee35af
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v4.x/ChangeLog-4.7.5
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1391908
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/1c109fabbd51863475cd12ac206bdd249aee35af
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161104 Re: kernel: fix minor infoleak in get_user_ex()
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/04/4

The __get_user_asm_ex macro in arch/x86/include/asm/uaccess.h in the
Linux kernel before 4.7.5 does not initialize a certain integer
variable, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information
from kernel stack memory by triggering failure of a get_user_ex call.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

lynx: It was found that Lynx doesn't parse the authority component of
the URL correctly when the host name part ends with '?', and could
instead be tricked into connecting to a different host.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9180
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161104)
Reference: BID:94219
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94219
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161104 Re: CVE request: XXE in perl Image:nfo and XML:wig

Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1177
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00020.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1204
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00033.html

perl-XML-Twig: The option to `expand_external_ents`, documented as
controlling external entity expansion in XML::Twig does not work.
External entities are always expanded, regardless of the option's
setting.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9181
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161104)
Reference: BID:94220
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94220
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161104 Re: CVE request: XXE in perl Image:nfo and XML:wig
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/04/2

perl-Image-Info: When parsing an SVG file, external entity expansion
(XXE) was not disabled. An attacker could craft an SVG file which,
when processed by an application using perl-Image-Info, could cause
denial of service or, potentially, information disclosure.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9182
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161104)
Reference: BID:94227
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94227
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/exponentcms/exponent-cms/commit/684d79424f768db8bb345d5c68aa2a886239492b

Exponent CMS 2.4 uses PHP reflection to call a method of a controller
class, and then uses the method name to check user permission. But,
the method name in PHP reflection is case insensitive, and Exponent
CMS permits undefined actions to execute by default, so an attacker
can use a capitalized method name to bypass the permission check,
e.g., controller=expHTMLEditor&action=preview&editor=ckeditor and
controller=expHTMLEditor&action=Preview&editor=ckeditor. An anonymous
user will be rejected for the former but can access the latter.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9183
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161104)
Reference: BID:94227
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94227
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/exponentcms/exponent-cms/commit/3b3557e9f6ba193a4c23c8ce5498fa285dddf3f3

In /framework/modules/ecommerce/controllers/orderController.php of
Exponent CMS 2.4.0, untrusted input is passed into selectObjectsBySql.
The method selectObjectsBySql of class mysqli_database uses the
injectProof method to prevent SQL injection, but this filter can be
bypassed easily: it only sanitizes user input if there are odd numbers
of ' or " characters. Impact is Information Disclosure.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9184
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161104)
Reference: BID:94227
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94227
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/exponentcms/exponent-cms/commit/0ce8b94d745b818bd207933d9a2e7f32587c2c89

In /framework/modules/core/controllers/expHTMLEditorController.php of
Exponent CMS 2.4.0, untrusted input is used to construct a table name,
and in the selectObject method in mysqli class, table names are
wrapped with a character that common filters do not filter, allowing
for SQL Injection. Impact is Information Disclosure.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9191
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161105)
Reference: BID:94129
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94129
Reference: CONFIRM:http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=93362fa47fe98b62e4a34ab408c4a418432e7939
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1392439
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/93362fa47fe98b62e4a34ab408c4a418432e7939
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docLocale=en_US&docId=emr_na-hpesbhf03802en_us
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3791
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3791
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161105 Re: CVE request: linux kernel - local DoS with cgroup offline code
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/05/4

The cgroup offline implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.8.11
mishandles certain drain operations, which allows local users to cause
a denial of service (system hang) by leveraging access to a container
environment for executing a crafted application, as demonstrated by
trinity.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9192
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161106)
Reference: BID:94770
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94770
Reference: CONFIRM:https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161207-anyconnect1

Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037409

A vulnerability in Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows
could allow an authenticated, local attacker to install and execute an
arbitrary executable file with privileges equivalent to the Microsoft
Windows operating system SYSTEM account. More Information: CSCvb68043.
Known Affected Releases: 4.3(2039) 4.3(748). Known Fixed Releases:
4.3(4019) 4.4(225).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9193
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161106)
Reference: BID:94801
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94801
Reference: CONFIRM:https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161207-firepower
Reference: SECTRACK:1037421
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037421

A vulnerability in the malicious file detection and blocking features
of Cisco Firepower Management Center and Cisco FireSIGHT System
Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass
malware detection mechanisms on an affected system. Affected Products:
Cisco Firepower Management Center and FireSIGHT System Software are
affected when they are configured to use a file policy that has the
Block Malware action. More Information: CSCvb27494. Known Affected
Releases: 6.0.1.1 6.1.0.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9194
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161106)
Reference: BID:97424
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97424
Reference: CONFIRM:https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc
Reference: SECTRACK:1038182
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038182

A vulnerability in 802.11 Wireless Multimedia Extensions (WME) action
frame processing in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) Software could
allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of
service (DoS) condition. The vulnerability is due to incomplete input
validation of the 802.11 WME packet header. An attacker could exploit
this vulnerability by sending malformed 802.11 WME frames to a
targeted device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to
cause the WLC to reload unexpectedly. The fixed versions are
8.0.140.0, 8.2.130.0, and 8.3.111.0. Cisco Bug IDs: CSCva86353.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

A vulnerability in login authentication management in Cisco Aironet
1800, 2800, and 3800 Series Access Point platforms could allow an
authenticated, local attacker to gain unrestricted root access to the
underlying Linux operating system. The root Linux shell is provided

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9219
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161106)
Reference: BID:97423
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97423
Reference: CONFIRM:https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc2
Reference: SECTRACK:1038183
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038183

A vulnerability with IPv6 UDP ingress packet processing in Cisco
Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) Software could allow an unauthenticated,
remote attacker to cause an unexpected reload of the device. The
vulnerability is due to incomplete IPv6 UDP header validation. An
attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted IPv6
UDP packet to a specific port on the targeted device. An exploit could
allow the attacker to impact the availability of the device as it
could unexpectedly reload. This vulnerability affects Cisco Wireless
LAN Controller (WLC) running software version 8.2.121.0 or 8.3.102.0.
Cisco Bug IDs: CSCva98592.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9220
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161106)
Reference: BID:95633
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95633

A Denial of Service Vulnerability in 802.11 ingress packet processing
of the Cisco Mobility Express 2800 and 3800 Access Points (APs) could
allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause the connection
table to be full of invalid connections and be unable to process new
incoming requests. More Information: CSCvb66659. Known Affected
Releases: 8.2(130.0). Known Fixed Releases: 8.2(131.10) 8.2(131.6)
8.2(141.0) 8.3(104.56) 8.4(1.88) 8.4(1.91).

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95788
Reference: CONFIRM:https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170125-cas
Reference: SECTRACK:1037696
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037696

A vulnerability in the data plane IP fragment handler of the Cisco
Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) CX Context-Aware Security module
could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the CX module
to be unable to process further traffic, resulting in a denial of
service (DoS) condition. The vulnerability is due to improper handling
of IP fragments. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by
sending crafted fragmented IP traffic across the CX module. An exploit
could allow the attacker to exhaust free packet buffers in shared
memory (SHM), causing the CX module to be unable to process further
traffic, resulting in a DoS condition. This vulnerability affects all
versions of the ASA CX Context-Aware Security module. Cisco has not
released and will not release software updates that address this
vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this
vulnerability. Cisco Bug IDs: CSCva62946.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

associate it with any vulnerability during 2016. Notes: none.

Reference: CONFIRM:https://cryptography.io/en/latest/changelog
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/commit/b924696b2e8731f39696584d12cceeb3aeb2d874

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2016-2d90e27e50

with a length less than algorithm.digest_size.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9244
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161109)
Reference: BID:96143
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96143
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05121675
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:41298
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/41298/
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/141017/Ticketbleed-F5-TLS-Information-Disclosure.html
Reference: MISC:https://blog.filippo.io/finding-ticketbleed/
Reference: MISC:https://filippo.io/Ticketbleed/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/0x00string/oldays/blob/master/CVE-2016-9244.py
Reference: SECTRACK:1037800
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037800

A BIG-IP virtual server configured with a Client SSL profile that has
the non-default Session Tickets option enabled may leak up to 31 bytes
of uninitialized memory. A remote attacker may exploit this
vulnerability to obtain Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) session IDs from
other sessions. It is possible that other data from uninitialized
memory may be returned as well.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9245
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161109)
Reference: BID:96471
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96471
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K22216037
Reference: SECTRACK:1037964
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037964

In F5 BIG-IP systems 12.1.0 - 12.1.2, malicious requests made to
virtual servers with an HTTP profile can cause the TMM to restart. The
issue is exposed with BIG-IP APM profiles, regardless of settings. The
issue is also exposed with the non-default "Normalize URI"
configuration options used in iRules and/or BIG-IP LTM policies. An
attacker may be able to disrupt traffic or cause the BIG-IP system to
fail over to another device in the device group.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9256
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161109)
Reference: BID:96464
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96464
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K47284724

In F5 BIG-IP 12.1.0 through 12.1.2, permissions enforced by iControl
can lag behind the actual permissions assigned to a user if the
role_map is not reloaded between the time the permissions are changed
and the time of the user's next request. This is a race condition that
occurs rarely in normal usage; the typical period in which this is
possible is limited to at most a few seconds after the permission
change.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

In F5 BIG-IP APM 12.0.0 through 12.1.2, non-authenticated users may be
able to inject JavaScript into a request that will then be rendered
and executed in the context of the Administrative user when the
Administrative user is viewing the Access System Logs, allowing the
non-authenticated user to carry out a Cross Site Scripting (XSS)
attack against the Administrative user.

Reference: CONFIRM:https://exponentcms.lighthouseapp.com/projects/61783/tickets/1395-blind-sql-injection-vulnerability-in-exponent-cms-240-5

A Blind SQL Injection Vulnerability in Exponent CMS through 2.4.0,
with the rerank array parameter, can lead to site database information
disclosure and denial of service.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9287
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161111)
Reference: BID:94322
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94322
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/exponentcms/exponent-cms/commit/4327ea96b3de89440693e06d03038121aa1fdcea

In /framework/modules/notfound/controllers/notfoundController.php of
Exponent CMS 2.4.0 patch1, untrusted input is passed into
getSearchResults. The method getSearchResults is defined in the search
model with the parameter '$term' used directly in SQL. Impact is a SQL
injection.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9288
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161111)
Reference: BID:94296
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94296
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/exponentcms/exponent-cms/commit/2ddffb2e7eafe4830e3483a4b437873022c461ba
Reference: SECTRACK:1037280
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037280

In framework/modules/navigation/controllers/navigationController.php
in Exponent CMS v2.4.0 or older, the parameter "target" of function
"DragnDropReRank" is directly used without any filtration which caused
SQL injection. The payload can be used like this:
/navigation/DragnDropReRank/target/1.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9296
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161111)
Reference: BID:94294
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94294
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/yangke/7zip-null-pointer-dereference
Reference: MISC:https://sourceforge.net/p/p7zip/bugs/185/
Reference: MISC:https://sourceforge.net/p/p7zip/discussion/383043/thread/648d34db/

A null pointer dereference bug affects the 16.02 and many old versions
of p7zip. A lack of null pointer check for the variable
folders.PackPositions in function
CInArchive::ReadAndDecodePackedStreams in
CPP/7zip/Archive/7z/7zIn.cpp, as used in the 7z.so library and in 7z
applications, will cause a crash and a denial of service when decoding
malformed 7z files.

attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via
crafted TIFF_SETGET_C16ASCII or TIFF_SETGET_C32_ASCII tag values.

Phase: Assigned(20161114)

Reference: CERT-VN:VU#633847
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/633847

Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.ntp.org/bin/view/Main/NtpBug3119

Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docLocale=en_US&docId=emr_na-hpesbhf03799en_us

Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017-0252.html

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3707-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3707-2/

ntpd in NTP before 4.2.8p9, when the trap service is enabled, allows
remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer
dereference and crash) via a crafted packet.

Name: CVE-2016-9312

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9313
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161114)
Reference: BID:94546
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94546
Reference: CONFIRM:http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=7df3e59c3d1df4f87fe874c7956ef7a3d2f4d5fb
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v4.x/ChangeLog-4.8.7
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/7df3e59c3d1df4f87fe874c7956ef7a3d2f4d5fb
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20160722 panic at big_key_preparse #4.7-r6/rc7 & master
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/07/22/1

security/keys/big_key.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8.7 mishandles
unsuccessful crypto registration in conjunction with successful key-
type registration, which allows local users to cause a denial of
service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) or possibly have
unspecified other impact via a crafted application that uses the
big_key data type.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9314
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161114)
Reference: BID:96252
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96252
Reference: CONFIRM:https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/1116672
Reference: SECTRACK:1037849
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037849

Sensitive Information Disclosure in
com.trend.iwss.gui.servlet.ConfigBackup in Trend Micro InterScan Web
Security Virtual Appliance (IWSVA) version 6.5-SP2_Build_Linux_1707
and earlier allows authenticated, remote users with least privileges
to backup the system configuration and download it onto their local
machine. This backup file contains sensitive information like
passwd/shadow files, RSA certificates, Private Keys and Default
Passphrase, etc. This was resolved in Version 6.5 CP 1737.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9315
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161114)
Reference: BID:96252
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96252
Reference: CONFIRM:https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/1116672
Reference: SECTRACK:1037849
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037849

Privilege Escalation Vulnerability in
com.trend.iwss.gui.servlet.updateaccountadministration in Trend Micro
InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance (IWSVA) version
6.5-SP2_Build_Linux_1707 and earlier allows authenticated, remote
users with least privileges to change Master Admin's password and/or
add new admin accounts. This was resolved in Version 6.5 CP 1737.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9316
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161114)
Reference: BID:96252
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96252
Reference: CONFIRM:https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/1116672
Reference: SECTRACK:1037849
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037849

Multiple stored Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in
com.trend.iwss.gui.servlet.updateaccountadministration in Trend Micro
InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance (IWSVA) version
6.5-SP2_Build_Linux_1707 and earlier allow authenticated, remote users
with least privileges to inject arbitrary HTML/JavaScript code into
web pages. This was resolved in Version 6.5 CP 1737.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9317
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161114)
Reference: BID:95841
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95841
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/libgd/libgd/blob/gd-2.2.4/CHANGELOG.md

The gdImageCreate function in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd)
before 2.2.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(system hang) via an oversized image.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9318
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161114)
Reference: BID:94347
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94347
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201711-01
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201711-01
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=772726
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/lsh123/xmlsec/issues/43
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20220408 [SECURITY] [DLA 2972-1] libxml2 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/04/msg00004.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3739-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3739-1/
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3739-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3739-2/

libxml2 2.9.4 and earlier, as used in XMLSec 1.2.23 and earlier and
other products, does not offer a flag directly indicating that the
current document may be read but other files may not be opened, which
makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct XML External Entity
(XXE) attacks via a crafted document.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9334
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: BID:95302
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95302
Reference: MISC:https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-16-336-06

An issue was discovered in Rockwell Automation Allen-Bradley
MicroLogix 1100 controller 1763-L16AWA, Series A and B, Version 14.000
and prior versions; 1763-L16BBB, Series A and B, Version 14.000 and
prior versions; 1763-L16BWA, Series A and B, Version 14.000 and prior
versions; and 1763-L16DWD, Series A and B, Version 14.000 and prior
versions. User credentials are sent to the web server in clear text,
which may allow an attacker to discover the credentials if they are
able to observe traffic between the web browser and the server.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9335
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: MISC:https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-17-054-02

A hard-coded cryptographic key vulnerability was identified in Red
Lion Controls Sixnet-Managed Industrial Switches running firmware
Version 5.0.196 and Stride-Managed Ethernet Switches running firmware
Version 5.0.190. Vulnerable versions of Stride-Managed Ethernet
switches and Sixnet-Managed Industrial switches use hard-coded HTTP
SSL/SSH keys for secure communication. Because these keys cannot be
regenerated by users, all products use the same key. The attacker
could disrupt communication or compromise the system. CVSS v3 base
score: 10, CVSS vector string: (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
Red Lion Controls recommends updating to SLX firmware Version 5.3.174.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: BID:94697
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94697

An issue was discovered in Tesla Motors Model S automobile, all
firmware versions before version 7.1 (2.36.31) with web browser
functionality enabled. The vehicle's Gateway ECU is susceptible to

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9338
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: BID:95302
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95302
Reference: MISC:https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-16-336-06

An issue was discovered in Rockwell Automation Allen-Bradley
MicroLogix 1100 controller 1763-L16AWA, Series A and B, Version 14.000
and prior versions; 1763-L16BBB, Series A and B, Version 14.000 and
prior versions; 1763-L16BWA, Series A and B, Version 14.000 and prior
versions; and 1763-L16DWD, Series A and B, Version 14.000 and prior
versions. Because of an Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical
Resource, users with administrator privileges may be able to remove
all administrative users requiring a factory reset to restore
ancillary web server function. Exploitation of this vulnerability will
still allow the affected device to function in its capacity as a
controller.

An issue was discovered in Moxa DACenter Versions 1.4 and older. A
specially crafted project file may cause the program to crash because
of Uncontrolled Resource Consumption.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9355
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: BID:96116
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96116
Reference: MISC:https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSMA-17-017-02

An issue was discovered in Becton, Dickinson and Company (BD) Alaris
8015 Point of Care (PC) unit, Version 9.5 and prior versions, and
Version 9.7. An unauthorized user with physical access to an Alaris
8015 PC unit may be able to obtain unencrypted wireless network
authentication credentials and other sensitive technical data by
disassembling an Alaris 8015 PC unit and accessing the device's flash
memory. Older software versions of the Alaris 8015 PC unit, Version
9.5 and prior versions, store wireless network authentication
credentials and other sensitive technical data on the affected
device's removable flash memory. Being able to remove the flash memory
from the affected device reduces the risk of detection, allowing an
attacker to extract stored data at the attacker's convenience.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9372
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: BID:94368
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94368
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=12851
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=4127e3930ef663114567002001f44e01eba8a250
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2016-58.html
Reference: SECTRACK:1037313
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037313

In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.1, the Profinet I/O dissector could loop
excessively, triggered by network traffic or a capture file. This was
addressed in plugins/profinet/packet-pn-rtc-one.c by rejecting input
with too many I/O objects.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9373
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: BID:94369
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94369
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=13072
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=cc8e37f0f53c4401bb1644a34eddea345940a8df
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2016-61.html
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3719
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2016/dsa-3719
Reference: SECTRACK:1037313
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037313

In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.1 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.7, the DCERPC dissector
could crash with a use-after-free, triggered by network traffic or a
capture file. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-dcerpc-nt.c
and epan/dissectors/packet-dcerpc-spoolss.c by using the wmem file
scope for private strings.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9374
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161116)
Reference: BID:94369
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94369
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=12953
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=a5770b6559b6e6765c4ef800e85ae42781ea4900

Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3719
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2016/dsa-3719
Reference: SECTRACK:1037313
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037313

In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.1 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.7, the AllJoyn dissector
could crash with a buffer over-read, triggered by network traffic or a
capture file. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-alljoyn.c
by ensuring that a length variable properly tracked the state of a
signature variable.

emulating instructions that generate software interrupts, allows local
HVM guest OS users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) by
leveraging an incorrect choice for software interrupt delivery.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9379
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161117)
Reference: BID:94473
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94473
Reference: CONFIRM:http://xenbits.xen.org/xsa/advisory-198.html

The pygrub boot loader emulator in Xen, when S-expression output
format is requested, allows local pygrub-using guest OS administrators
to read or delete arbitrary files on the host via string quotes and
S-expressions in the bootloader configuration file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9380
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161117)
Reference: BID:94473

The pygrub boot loader emulator in Xen, when nul-delimited output
format is requested, allows local pygrub-using guest OS administrators
to read or delete arbitrary files on the host via NUL bytes in the
bootloader configuration file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9381

administrators to gain privileges by changing certain data on shared
rings, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9382
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161117)
Reference: BID:94470
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94470
Reference: CONFIRM:http://xenbits.xen.org/xsa/advisory-192.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX218775
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201612-56
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201612-56
Reference: SECTRACK:1037341
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037341

Xen 4.0.x through 4.7.x mishandle x86 task switches to VM86 mode,
which allows local 32-bit x86 HVM guest OS users to gain privileges or
cause a denial of service (guest OS crash) by leveraging a guest
operating system that uses hardware task switching and allows a new
task to start in VM86 mode.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9383

Phase: Assigned(20161117)

Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201612-56
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201612-56
Reference: SECTRACK:1037346
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037346

Xen, when running on a 64-bit hypervisor, allows local x86 guest OS
users to modify arbitrary memory and consequently obtain sensitive
information, cause a denial of service (host crash), or execute
arbitrary code on the host by leveraging broken emulation of bit test
instructions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9384
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161117)
Reference: BID:94468
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94468
Reference: CONFIRM:http://xenbits.xen.org/xsa/advisory-194.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://xenbits.xen.org/xsa/xsa194.patch
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201612-56
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201612-56
Reference: SECTRACK:1037343
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037343

Xen 4.7 allows local guest OS users to obtain sensitive host
information by loading a 32-bit ELF symbol table.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9385
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161117)
Reference: BID:94472
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94472
Reference: CONFIRM:http://xenbits.xen.org/xsa/advisory-193.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX218775
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201612-56
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201612-56
Reference: SECTRACK:1037342
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037342

The x86 segment base write emulation functionality in Xen 4.4.x
through 4.7.x allows local x86 PV guest OS administrators to cause a
denial of service (host crash) by leveraging lack of canonical address
checks.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9386
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161117)
Reference: BID:94471
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94471
Reference: CONFIRM:http://xenbits.xen.org/xsa/advisory-191.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX218775
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201612-56
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201612-56
Reference: SECTRACK:1037340
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037340

The x86 emulator in Xen does not properly treat x86 NULL segments as
unusable when accessing memory, which might allow local HVM guest
users to gain privileges via vectors involving "unexpected" base/limit
values.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9422
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161118)
Reference: BID:94407
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94407
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/tats/w3m/blob/master/ChangeLog
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/tats/w3m/issues/8
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201701-08
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-08
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161118 Re: CVE request: w3m - multiple vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/18/3

An issue was discovered in the Tatsuya Kinoshita w3m fork before
0.5.3-31. The feed_table_tag function in w3m doesn't properly validate
the value of table span, which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (stack and/or heap buffer overflow) and possibly
execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9446
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161118)
Reference: BID:94423
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94423
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=774533

Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/UM7IXFGHV66KNWGWG6ZBDNKXD2UJL2VQ/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201705-10
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201705-10
Reference: MISC:https://scarybeastsecurity.blogspot.de/2016/11/0day-poc-risky-design-decisions-in.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161118 CVE Request: gstreamer plugins
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/18/12
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161118 Re: CVE Request: gstreamer plugins
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/18/13
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2060
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2060

The vmnc decoder in the gstreamer does not initialize the render
canvas, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information
as demonstrated by thumbnailing a simple 1 frame vmnc movie that does
not draw to the allocated render canvas.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9448
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161118)
Reference: BID:94420
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94420
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3762
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3762
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201701-16
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-16
Reference: MISC:http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2593
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161118 Re: CVE-2016-9297 LibTIFF regression
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/18/15
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2016:3035
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2016-12/msg00017.html

The TIFFFetchNormalTag function in LibTiff 4.0.6 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and
crash) by setting the tags TIFF_SETGET_C16ASCII or
TIFF_SETGET_C32_ASCII to values that access 0-byte arrays.  NOTE: this
vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-9297.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

tags.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9454
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:83964
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/83964
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/f6880330a8e11e804663f132867e9eb9b1f94e83
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-001/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.3 suffers from Persistent XSS. A vector for
persistent XSS attacks via the Revive Adserver user interface exists,
requiring a trusted (non-admin) account. The banner image URL for
external banners wasn't properly escaped when displayed in most of the
banner related pages.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9455
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:83964
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/83964
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/65a9c8119b4bc7493fd957e1a8d6f6f731298b45
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/97123
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-001/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.3 suffers from Cross-Site Request Forgery
(CSRF). A number of scripts in Revive Adserver's user interface are
vulnerable to CSRF attacks: `www/admin/banner-acl.php`,
`www/admin/banner-activate.php`, `www/admin/banner-advanced.php`,
`www/admin/banner-modify.php`, `www/admin/banner-swf.php`,
`www/admin/banner-zone.php`, `www/admin/tracker-modify.php`.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9456
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:83964
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/83964
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/e563ca61e4f3b7210cb61f53284adaa8aef4a49a
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-001/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.3 suffers from Cross-Site Request Forgery
(CSRF). The Revive Adserver team conducted a security audit of the
admin interface scripts in order to identify and fix other potential
CSRF vulnerabilities. Over 20+ such issues were fixed.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9457
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:83964
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/83964
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/ecbe822b48ef4ff61c2c6357c0c94199a81946f4
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/107879
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-001/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.3 suffers from Reflected XSS.
`www/admin/stats.php` is vulnerable to reflected XSS attacks via
multiple parameters that are not properly sanitised or escaped when
displayed, such as setPerPage, pageId, bannerid, period_start,
period_end, and possibly others.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9459
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:97284
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97284
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/94975af6db1551c2d23136c2ea22866a5b416070
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/044ee072a647636b1a17c89265c7233b35371335
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/b7fa2c5dc945b40bc6ed0a9a0e47c282ebf043e1
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/efa35d621dc7ff975468e636a5d1c153511296dc
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/146278
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-002
Reference: MISC:https://owncloud.org/security/advisory?id=oc-sa-2016-012

Nextcloud Server before 9.0.52 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.4 are
vulnerable to a log pollution vulnerability potentially leading to a
local XSS. The download log functionality in the admin screen is
delivering the log in JSON format to the end-user. The file was
delivered with an attachment disposition forcing the browser to
download the document. However, Firefox running on Microsoft Windows
would offer the user to open the data in the browser as an HTML
document. Thus any injected data in the log would be executed.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9460
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:97282
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97282
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/2da43e3751576bbc838f238a09955c4dcdebee8e
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/8aa0832bd449c44ec300da4189bd8ed4e036140c
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/dea8e29289a1b99d5e889627c2e377887f4f2983
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/c92c234059f8b1dc7d53122985ec0d398895a2cf
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/145463
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-003
Reference: MISC:https://owncloud.org/security/advisory/?id=oc-sa-2016-013

Nextcloud Server before 9.0.52 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.4 are
vulnerable to a content-spoofing attack in the files app. The location
bar in the files app was not verifying the passed parameters. An
attacker could craft an invalid link to a fake directory structure and
use this to display an attacker-controlled error message to the user.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9461
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:97276
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97276
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/3491400261c1454a9a30d3ec96969573330120cc
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/0622e635d97cb17c5e1363e370bb8268cc3d2547
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/121a3304a0c37ccda0e1b63ddc528cba9121a36e
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/acbbadb71ceee7f01da347f7dcd519beda78cc47
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/c0a4b7b3f38ad2eaf506484b3b92ec678cb021c9
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/145950
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-004
Reference: MISC:https://owncloud.org/security/advisory/?id=oc-sa-2016-014

Nextcloud Server before 9.0.52 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.4 are not
properly verifying edit check permissions on WebDAV copy actions. The
WebDAV endpoint was not properly checking the permission on a WebDAV
COPY action. This allowed an authenticated attacker with access to a
read-only share to put new files in there. It was not possible to
modify existing files.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9462
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:97285
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97285
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/1208953ba1d4d55a18a639846bbcdd66a2d5bc5e
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/23383080731d092e079986464a8c4c9ffcb79f4c
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/3b056fa68ce502ceb0db9b446dab3b9e7b10dd13
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/c93eca49c32428ece03dd67042772d5fa62c8d6e
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/d31720b6f1e8c8dfeb5e8805ab35ad7c8000b2f1
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/146067
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-005
Reference: MISC:https://owncloud.org/security/advisory/?id=oc-sa-2016-015

Nextcloud Server before 9.0.52 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.4 are not
properly verifying restore privileges when restoring a file. The
restore capability of Nextcloud/ownCloud was not verifying whether a
user has only read-only access to a share. Thus a user with read-only
access was able to restore old versions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9463
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/apps/commit/b85ace6840b8a6704641086bc3b8eb8e81cb2274
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/apps/commit/decb91fd31f4ffab191cbf09ce4e5c55c67a4087
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/apps/commit/16cbccfc946c8711721fa684d78135ca1fb64791
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/apps/commit/5d47e7b52646cf79edadd78ce10c754290cbb732
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/apps/commit/a0e07b7ddd5a5fd850a6e07f8457d05b76a300b3
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/148151
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-006
Reference: MISC:https://owncloud.org/security/advisory/?id=oc-sa-2016-017
Reference: MISC:https://rhinosecuritylabs.com/2016/10/operation-ownedcloud-exploitation-post-exploitation-persistence/

Nextcloud Server before 9.0.54 and 10.0.1 & ownCloud Server before
9.1.2, 9.0.6, and 8.2.9 suffer from SMB User Authentication Bypass.
Nextcloud/ownCloud include an optional and not by default enabled SMB
authentication component that allows authenticating users against an
SMB server. This backend is implemented in a way that tries to connect
to a SMB server and if that succeeded consider the user logged-in. The
backend did not properly take into account SMB servers that have any
kind of anonymous auth configured. This is the default on SMB servers
nowadays and allows an unauthenticated attacker to gain access to an
account without valid credentials. Note: The SMB backend is disabled
by default and requires manual configuration in the Nextcloud/ownCloud
config file. If you have not configured the SMB backend then you're
not affected by this vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9464
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: BID:97287
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97287
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/3387e5d00fcf6b2ea6b285a091e5743f545e7202
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/7289cb5ec0b812992ab0dfb889744b94bc0994f0
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/a5471b4a3e3f30e99e4de39c97c0c3b3c2f1618f
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/e2c4f4f9aa11bc92e8f2212cce73841b922187e8
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/153905
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-007

Nextcloud Server before 9.0.54 and 10.0.0 suffers from an improper
authorization check on removing shares. The Sharing Backend as
implemented in Nextcloud does differentiate between shares to users
and groups. In case of a received group share, users should be able to
unshare the file to themselves but not to the whole group. The
previous API implementation simply unshared the file to all users in
the group.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9465
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/server/commit/68ab8325c799d20c1fb7e98d670785176590e7d0
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/6bf3be3877d9d9fda9c66926fe273fe79cbaf58e
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/b5a5be24c418033cb2ef965a4f3f06b7b4213845
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/163338
Reference: MISC:https://nextcloud.com/security/advisory/?id=nc-sa-2016-008
Reference: MISC:https://owncloud.org/security/advisory/?id=oc-sa-2016-018

Nextcloud Server before 10.0.1 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.6 and
9.1.2 suffer from Stored XSS in CardDAV image export. The CardDAV
image export functionality as implemented in Nextcloud/ownCloud allows
the download of images stored within a vCard. Due to not performing
any kind of verification on the image content this is prone to a
stored Cross-Site Scripting attack.


Current Votes:

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9466
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/nextcloud/gallery/commit/f9ef505c1d60c9041e251682e0f6b3daad952d58

Nextcloud Server before 10.0.1 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.6 and
9.1.2 suffer from Reflected XSS in the Gallery application. The
gallery app was not properly sanitizing exception messages from the
Nextcloud/ownCloud server. Due to an endpoint where an attacker could
influence the error message, this led to a reflected Cross-Site-
Scripting vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9469
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://about.gitlab.com/2016/12/05/cve-2016-9469/
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/commit/29ceb98b5162677601702704e89d845580372078
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/commit/55196497301eea429913f9c4b1b37c42c2e358ce
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/commit/f325e4e734e5e486f3b02db176eb629124052b43
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/25064
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/186194

Multiple versions of GitLab expose a dangerous method to any
authenticated user that could lead to the deletion of all Issue and
MergeRequest objects on a GitLab instance. For GitLab instances with
publicly available projects this vulnerability could be exploited by
an unauthenticated user. A fix was included in versions 8.14.3,
8.13.8, and 8.12.11, which were released on December 5th 2016 at 3:59
PST. The GitLab versions vulnerable to this are 8.13.0, 8.13.0-ee,
8.13.1, 8.13.1-ee, 8.13.2, 8.13.2-ee, 8.13.3, 8.13.3-ee, 8.13.4,
8.13.4-ee, 8.13.5, 8.13.5-ee, 8.13.6, 8.13.6-ee, 8.13.7, 8.14.0,
8.14.0-ee, 8.14.1, 8.14.2, and 8.14.2-ee.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9470
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/69aacbd2
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/148745
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-002/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.5 and 4.0.0 suffers from Reflected File
Download. `www/delivery/asyncspc.php` was vulnerable to the fairly new
Reflected File Download (RFD) web attack vector that enables attackers
to gain complete control over a victim's machine by virtually
downloading a file from a trusted domain.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9471
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/05b1eceb
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/128181
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-002/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.5 and 4.0.0 suffers from Special Element
Injection. Usernames weren't properly sanitised when creating users on
a Revive Adserver instance. Especially, control characters were not
filtered, allowing apparently identical usernames to co-exist in the
system, due to the fact that such characters are normally ignored when
an HTML page is displayed in a browser. The issue could have therefore
been exploited for user spoofing, although elevated privileges are
required to create users within Revive Adserver.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9472
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161119)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/14ff73f0
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/fcf72c8a
Reference: MISC:https://hackerone.com/reports/170156
Reference: MISC:https://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2016-002/

Revive Adserver before 3.2.5 and 4.0.0 suffers from Reflected XSS. The
Revive Adserver web installer scripts were vulnerable to a reflected
XSS attack via the dbHost, dbUser, and possibly other parameters. It
has to be noted that the window for such attack vectors to be possible
is extremely narrow and it is very unlikely that such an attack could
be actually effective.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9481
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94590
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94590
Reference: MISC:http://www.pang0lin.com/?p=1076

Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1037368

In framework/modules/core/controllers/expCommentController.php of
Exponent CMS 2.4.0, content_id input is passed into showComments. The
method showComments is defined in the expCommentControllercontroller
with the parameter '$this->params['content_id']' used directly in SQL.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9482
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94778
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94778
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#494015
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/494015

Code generated by PHP FormMail Generator may allow a remote
unauthenticated user to bypass authentication in the to access the
administrator panel by navigating directly to
/admin.php?mod=admin&func=panel

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9483
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94778
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94778
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#494015
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/494015

The PHP form code generated by PHP FormMail Generator deserializes
untrusted input as part of the phpfmg_filman_download() function. A
remote unauthenticated attacker may be able to use this vulnerability
to inject PHP code, or along with CVE-2016-9484 to perform local file
inclusion attacks and obtain files from the server.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9484
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94778
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94778
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#494015
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/494015

The generated PHP form code does not properly validate user input
folder directories, allowing a remote unauthenticated attacker to
perform a path traversal and access arbitrary files on the server. The
PHP FormMail Generator website does not use version numbers and is
updated continuously. Any PHP form code generated by this website
prior to 2016-12-06 may be vulnerable.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9485
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94740
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94740
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#768331
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/768331

On Windows endpoints, the SecureConnector agent must run under the
local SYSTEM account or another administrator account in order to
enable full functionality of the agent. The typical configuration is
for the agent to run as a Windows service under the local SYSTEM
account. The SecureConnector agent runs various plugin scripts and
executables on the endpoint in order to gather and report information
about the host to the CounterACT management appliance. The
SecureConnector agent downloads these scripts and executables as
needed from the CounterACT management appliance and runs them on the
endpoint. The SecureConnector agent fails to set any permissions on
downloaded file objects. This allows a malicious user to take
ownership of any of these files and make modifications to it,
regardless of where the files are saved. These files are then executed
under SYSTEM privileges. A malicious unprivileged user can overwrite
these executable files with malicious code before the SecureConnector
agent executes them, causing the malicious code to be run under the
SYSTEM account.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9486
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94740
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94740
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#768331
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/768331

On Windows endpoints, the SecureConnector agent must run under the
local SYSTEM account or another administrator account in order to
enable full functionality of the agent. The typical configuration is
for the agent to run as a Windows service under the local SYSTEM
account. The SecureConnector agent runs various plugin scripts and
executables on the endpoint in order to gather and report information
about the host to the CounterACT management appliance. The
SecureConnector agent downloads these scripts and executables as
needed from the CounterACT management appliance and runs them on the
endpoint. By default, these executable files are downloaded to and run
from the %TEMP% directory of the currently logged on user, despite the
fact that the SecureConnector agent is running as SYSTEM. Aside from
the downloaded scripts, the SecureConnector agent runs a batch file
with SYSTEM privileges from the temp directory of the currently logged
on user. If the naming convention of this script can be derived, which
is made possible by placing it in a directory to which the user has
read access, it may be possible overwrite the legitimate batch file
with a malicious one before SecureConnector executes it. It is
possible to change this directory by setting the the configuration
property config.script_run_folder.value in the local.properties
configuration file on the CounterACT management appliance, however the
batch file which is run does not follow this property.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9487
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94864
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94864/
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#779243
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/779243

EpubCheck 4.0.1 does not properly restrict resolving external entities
when parsing XML in EPUB files during validation. An attacker who
supplies a specially crafted EPUB file may be able to exploit this
behavior to read arbitrary files, or have the victim execute arbitrary
requests on his behalf, abusing the victim's trust relationship with
other entities.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9488
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:97394
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97394
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.manageengine.com/products/applications_manager/security-updates/security-updates-cve-2016-9488.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20170404 ManageEngine Applications Manager Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Apr/9
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/158554/ManageEngine-Applications-Manager-13-SQL-Injection.html
Reference: MISC:https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/142022/ManageEngine-Applications-Manager-12-13-XSS-SQL-Injection-Code-Execution.html

ManageEngine Applications Manager versions 12 and 13 before build
13200 suffer from remote SQL injection vulnerabilities. An
unauthenticated attacker is able to access the URL
/servlet/MenuHandlerServlet, which is vulnerable to SQL injection. The
attacker could extract users' password hashes, which are MD5 hashes
without salt, and, depending on the database type and its
configuration, could also execute operating system commands using SQL
queries.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9489
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:97394
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97394/
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.manageengine.com/products/applications_manager/security-updates/security-updates-cve-2016-9489.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20170404 ManageEngine Applications Manager Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Apr/9

In ManageEngine Applications Manager 12 and 13 before build 13200, an
authenticated user is able to alter all of their own properties,
including own group, i.e. changing their group to one with higher
privileges like "ADMIN". A user is also able to change properties of
another user, e.g. change another user's password.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9490
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:97394
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97394
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.manageengine.com/products/applications_manager/security-updates/security-updates-cve-2016-9490.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20170404 ManageEngine Applications Manager Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Apr/9
Reference: MISC:https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/142022/ManageEngine-Applications-Manager-12-13-XSS-SQL-Injection-Code-Execution.html

ManageEngine Applications Manager versions 12 and 13 before build
13200 suffer from a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability.
Applications Manager is prone to a Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability
in parameter LIMIT, in URL path
/DiagAlertAction.do?REQTYPE=AJAX&LIMIT=1233. The URL is also available
without authentication.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9491
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:97394
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97394/
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.manageengine.com/products/applications_manager/security-updates/security-updates-cve-2016-9491.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20170404 ManageEngine Applications Manager Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Apr/9

ManageEngine Applications Manager 12 and 13 before build 13690 allows
an authenticated user, who is able to access /register.do page (most
likely limited to administrator), to browse the filesystem and read
the system files, including Applications Manager configuration, stored
private keys, etc. By default Application Manager is running with
administrative privileges, therefore it is possible to access every
directory on the underlying operating system.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9492
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96718
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96718
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#608591
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/608591

The code generated by PHP FormMail Generator prior to 17 December 2016
is vulnerable to unrestricted upload of dangerous file types. In the
generated form.lib.php file, upload file types are checked against a
hard-coded list of dangerous extensions. This list does not include
all variations of PHP files, which may lead to execution of the
contained PHP code if the attacker can guess the uploaded filename.
The form by default appends a short random string to the end of the
filename.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9493
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96718
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96718
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#608591
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/608591

The code generated by PHP FormMail Generator prior to 17 December 2016
is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. In the generated
form.lib.php file, upload file types are checked against a hard-coded
list of dangerous extensions. This list does not include all
variations of PHP files, which may lead to execution of the contained
PHP code if the attacker can guess the uploaded filename. The form by
default appends a short random string to the end of the filename.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9494
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96244
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96244
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#614751
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/614751

Hughes high-performance broadband satellite modems, models HN7740S
DW7000 HN7000S/SM, are potentially vulnerable to improper input
validation. The device's advanced status web page that is linked to
from the basic status web page does not appear to properly parse
malformed GET requests. This may lead to a denial of service.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9495
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96244
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96244
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#614751
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/614751

Hughes high-performance broadband satellite modems, models HN7740S
DW7000 HN7000S/SM, uses hard coded credentials. Access to the device's
default telnet port (23) can be obtained through using one of a few
default credentials shared among all devices.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9496
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96244
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96244
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#614751
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/614751

Hughes high-performance broadband satellite modems, models HN7740S
DW7000 HN7000S/SM, lacks authentication. An unauthenticated user may
send an HTTP GET request to http://[ip]/com/gatewayreset or
http://[ip]/cgi/reboot.bin to cause the modem to reboot.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9497
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96244
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96244
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#614751
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/614751

Hughes high-performance broadband satellite modems, models HN7740S
DW7000 HN7000S/SM, is vulnerable to an authentication bypass using an
alternate path or channel. By default, port 1953 is accessible via
telnet and does not require authentication. An unauthenticated remote
user can access many administrative commands via this interface,
including rebooting the modem.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9498
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:97394
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97394/
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.manageengine.com/products/applications_manager/security-updates/security-updates-cve-2016-9498.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20170404 ManageEngine Applications Manager Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Apr/9

ManageEngine Applications Manager 12 and 13 before build 13200, allows
unserialization of unsafe Java objects. The vulnerability can be
exploited by remote user without authentication and it allows to
execute remote code compromising the application as well as the
operating system. As Application Manager's RMI registry is running
with privileges of system administrator, by exploiting this
vulnerability an attacker gains highest privileges on the underlying
operating system.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9499
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96154
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96154
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#745607
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/745607
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2016/12/06/qsa-2016-12-06/qsa-2016-12-06.pdf

Accellion FTP server prior to version FTA_9_12_220 only returns the
username in the server response if the username is invalid. An
attacker may use this information to determine valid user accounts and
enumerate them.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9500
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:96154
Reference: URL:https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96154
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#745607
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/745607
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2016/12/06/qsa-2016-12-06/qsa-2016-12-06.pdf

Accellion FTP server prior to version FTA_9_12_220 uses the Accusoft
Prizm Content flash component, which contains multiple parameters
(customTabCategoryName, customButton1Image) that are vulnerable to
cross-site scripting.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9532
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94424
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94424
Reference: CONFIRM:http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2592
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1397726
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3762
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3762
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201701-16
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-16
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161111 CVE request: LibTIFF tiffcrop: Heap buffer overflow via writeBufferToSeparateStrips
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/11/14
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161121 Re: CVE request: LibTIFF tiffcrop: Heap buffer overflow via writeBufferToSeparateStrips
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/21/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20161121 Re: CVE request: LibTIFF tiffcrop: Heap buffer overflow via writeBufferToSeparateStrips
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/22/1

Integer overflow in the writeBufferToSeparateStrips function in
tiffcrop.c in LibTIFF before 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted tif file.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9533
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94484
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94484
Reference: BID:94742
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94742
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/vadz/libtiff/commit/83a4b92815ea04969d494416eaae3d4c6b338e4a#diff-bdc795f6afeb9558c1012b3cfae729ef
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3762
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3762
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:0225
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017-0225.html

tif_pixarlog.c in libtiff 4.0.6 has out-of-bounds write
vulnerabilities in heap allocated buffers. Reported as MSVR 35094, aka
"PixarLog horizontalDifference heap-buffer-overflow."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9534
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94484
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94484
Reference: BID:94743
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94743
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/vadz/libtiff/commit/83a4b92815ea04969d494416eaae3d4c6b338e4a#diff-5be5ce02d0dea67050d5b2a10102d1ba
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3762
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3762
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:0225
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017-0225.html

tif_write.c in libtiff 4.0.6 has an issue in the error code path of
TIFFFlushData1() that didn't reset the tif_rawcc and tif_rawcp
members. Reported as MSVR 35095, aka "TIFFFlushData1 heap-buffer-
overflow."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9535
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94484
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94484
Reference: BID:94744
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94744
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/vadz/libtiff/commit/3ca657a8793dd011bf869695d72ad31c779c3cc1
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/vadz/libtiff/commit/6a984bf7905c6621281588431f384e79d11a2e33
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3844
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3844
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:0225
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017-0225.html

tif_predict.h and tif_predict.c in libtiff 4.0.6 have assertions that
can lead to assertion failures in debug mode, or buffer overflows in
release mode, when dealing with unusual tile size like YCbCr with
subsampling. Reported as MSVR 35105, aka "Predictor heap-buffer-
overflow."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9536
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94484

tools/tiff2pdf.c in libtiff 4.0.6 has out-of-bounds write

Reported as MSVR 35098, aka "t2p_process_jpeg_strip heap-buffer-

======================================================
Name: CVE-2016-9537
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161121)
Reference: BID:94484
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94484
Reference: BID:94746
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94746
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/vadz/libtiff/commit/83a4b92815ea04969d494416eaae3d4c6b338e4a#diff-c8b4b355f9b5c06d585b23138e1c185f

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:0225
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017-0225.html

tools/tiffcrop.c in libtiff 4.0.6 has out-of-bounds write
vulnerabilities in buffers. Reported as MSVR 35093, MSVR 35096, and
MSVR 35097.


Current Votes:
