======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000097
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/golang/go/issues/18141
Reference: CONFIRM:https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/33721/
Reference: CONFIRM:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/golang-dev/4NdLzS8sls8/uIz8QlnIBQAJ

On Darwin, user's trust preferences for root certificates were not
honored. If the user had a root certificate loaded in their Keychain
that was explicitly not trusted, a Go program would still verify a
connection using that root certificate.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000098
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://golang.org/cl/30410
Reference: CONFIRM:https://golang.org/issue/17965
Reference: CONFIRM:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/golang-dev/4NdLzS8sls8/uIz8QlnIBQAJ

The net/http package's Request.ParseMultipartForm method starts
writing to temporary files once the request body size surpasses the
given "maxMemory" limit. It was possible for an attacker to generate a
multipart request crafted such that the server ran out of file
descriptors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000099
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100281
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100281
Reference: CONFIRM:https://curl.haxx.se/0809C.patch
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-14
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-14
Reference: SECTRACK:1039119
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039119

When asking to get a file from a file:// URL, libcurl provides a
feature that outputs meta-data about the file using HTTP-like headers.
The code doing this would send the wrong buffer to the user (stdout or
the application's provide callback), which could lead to other private
data from the heap to get inadvertently displayed. The wrong buffer
was an uninitialized memory area allocated on the heap and if it
turned out to not contain any zero byte, it would continue and display
the data following that buffer in memory.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-10001
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170621)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpujul2017-3236622.html
Reference: SECTRACK:1038941
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038941

Vulnerability in the Oracle Hospitality Simphony First Edition
component of Oracle Hospitality Applications (subcomponent: Core). The
supported version that is affected is 1.7.1. Easily exploitable
vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via
HTTP to compromise Oracle Hospitality Simphony First Edition.
Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than
the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in
unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle
Hospitality Simphony First Edition accessible data as well as
unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Oracle
Hospitality Simphony First Edition accessible data and unauthorized
ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS)
of Oracle Hospitality Simphony First Edition. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.6
(Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:
(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:H).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000100
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100286
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100286
Reference: CONFIRM:https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_20170809B.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208221
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3992
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3992
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-14
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-14
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: SECTRACK:1039118
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039118

When doing a TFTP transfer and curl/libcurl is given a URL that
contains a very long file name (longer than about 515 bytes), the file
name is truncated to fit within the buffer boundaries, but the buffer
size is still wrongly updated to use the untruncated length. This too
large value is then used in the sendto() call, making curl attempt to
send more data than what is actually put into the buffer. The endto()
function will then read beyond the end of the heap based buffer. A
malicious HTTP(S) server could redirect a vulnerable libcurl-using
client to a crafted TFTP URL (if the client hasn't restricted which
protocols it allows redirects to) and trick it to send private memory
contents to a remote server over UDP. Limit curl's redirect protocols
with --proto-redir and libcurl's with CURLOPT_REDIR_PROTOCOLS.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000101
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100249
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100249
Reference: CONFIRM:https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_20170809A.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208221
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3992
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3992
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-14
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-14
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: SECTRACK:1039117
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039117

curl supports "globbing" of URLs, in which a user can pass a numerical
range to have the tool iterate over those numbers to do a sequence of
transfers. In the globbing function that parses the numerical range,
there was an omission that made curl read a byte beyond the end of the
URL if given a carefully crafted, or just wrongly written, URL. The
URL is stored in a heap based buffer, so it could then be made to
wrongly read something else instead of crashing. An example of a URL
that triggers the flaw would be `http://ur%20[0-60000000000000000000`.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000102
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:101061
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101061
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The Details view of some Static Analysis Utilities based plugins, was
vulnerable to a persisted cross-site scripting vulnerability:
Malicious users able to influence the input to these plugins, for
example the console output which is parsed to extract build warnings
(Warnings Plugin), could insert arbitrary HTML into this view.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000103
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:101061
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101061
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The custom Details view of the Static Analysis Utilities based DRY
Plugin, was vulnerable to a persisted cross-site scripting
vulnerability: Malicious users able to influence the input to this
plugin could insert arbitrary HTML into this view.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000104
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The Config File Provider Plugin is used to centrally manage
configuration files that often include secrets, such as passwords.
Users with only Overall/Read access to Jenkins were able to access
URLs directly that allowed viewing these files. Access to view these
files now requires sufficient permissions to configure the provided
files, view the configuration of the folder in which the configuration
files are defined, or have Job/Configure permissions to a job able to
use these files.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000105
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The optional Run/Artifacts permission can be enabled by setting a Java
system property. Blue Ocean did not check this permission before
providing access to archived artifacts, Item/Read permission was
sufficient.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000106
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

Blue Ocean allows the creation of GitHub organization folders that are
set up to scan a GitHub organization for repositories and branches
containing a Jenkinsfile, and create corresponding pipelines in
Jenkins. Its SCM content REST API supports the pipeline creation and
editing feature in Blue Ocean. The SCM content REST API did not check
the current user's authentication or credentials. If the GitHub
organization folder was created via Blue Ocean, it retained a
reference to its creator's GitHub credentials. This allowed users with
read access to the GitHub organization folder to create arbitrary
commits in the repositories inside the GitHub organization
corresponding to the GitHub organization folder with the GitHub
credentials of the creator of the organization folder. Additionally,
users with read access to the GitHub organization folder could read
arbitrary file contents from the repositories inside the GitHub
organization corresponding to the GitHub organization folder if the
branch contained a Jenkinsfile (which could be created using the other
part of this vulnerability), and they could provide the organization
folder name, repository name, branch name, and file name.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000107
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

Script Security Plugin did not apply sandboxing restrictions to
constructor invocations via positional arguments list, super
constructor invocations, method references, and type coercion
expressions. This could be used to invoke arbitrary constructors and
methods, bypassing sandbox protection.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000108
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The Pipeline: Input Step Plugin by default allowed users with
Item/Read access to a pipeline to interact with the step to provide
input. This has been changed, and now requires users to have the
Item/Build permission instead.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000110
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

Blue Ocean allows the creation of GitHub organization folders that are
set up to scan a GitHub organization for repositories and branches
containing a Jenkinsfile, and create corresponding pipelines in
Jenkins. It did not properly check the current user's authentication
and authorization when configuring existing GitHub organization
folders. This allowed users with read access to the GitHub
organization folder to reconfigure it, including changing the GitHub
API endpoint for the organization folder to an attacker-controlled
server to obtain the GitHub access token, if the organization folder
was initially created using Blue Ocean.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000111
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100267
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100267
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2017-1000111
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3981
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3981
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2918
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2918
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2930
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2930
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2931
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2931
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3200
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3200
Reference: SECTRACK:1039132
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039132

Linux kernel: heap out-of-bounds in AF_PACKET sockets. This new issue
is analogous to previously disclosed CVE-2016-8655. In both cases, a
socket option that changes socket state may race with safety checks in
packet_set_ring. Previously with PACKET_VERSION. This time with
PACKET_RESERVE. The solution is similar: lock the socket for the
update. This issue may be exploitable, we did not investigate further.
As this issue affects PF_PACKET sockets, it requires CAP_NET_RAW in
the process namespace. But note that with user namespaces enabled, any
process can create a namespace in which it has CAP_NET_RAW.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000112
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100262
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100262
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3981
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3981
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:45147
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45147/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/xairy/kernel-exploits/tree/master/CVE-2017-1000112
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20170810 Linux kernel: CVE-2017-1000112: Exploitable memory corruption due to UFO to non-UFO path switch
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q3/277
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2918
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2918
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2930
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2930
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2931
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2931
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3200
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3200
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2019:1931
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:1931
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2019:1932
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:1932
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2019:4159
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:4159
Reference: SECTRACK:1039162
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039162

Linux kernel: Exploitable memory corruption due to UFO to non-UFO path
switch. When building a UFO packet with MSG_MORE __ip_append_data()
calls ip_ufo_append_data() to append. However in between two send()
calls, the append path can be switched from UFO to non-UFO one, which
leads to a memory corruption. In case UFO packet lengths exceeds MTU,
copy = maxfraglen - skb->len becomes negative on the non-UFO path and
the branch to allocate new skb is taken. This triggers fragmentation
and computation of fraggap = skb_prev->len - maxfraglen. Fraggap can
exceed MTU, causing copy = datalen - transhdrlen - fraggap to become
negative. Subsequently skb_copy_and_csum_bits() writes out-of-bounds.
A similar issue is present in IPv6 code. The bug was introduced in
e89e9cf539a2 ("[IPv4/IPv6]: UFO Scatter-gather approach") on Oct 18
2005.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000113
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The Deploy to container Plugin stored passwords unencrypted as part of
its configuration. This allowed users with Jenkins master local file
system access, or users with Extended Read access to the jobs it is
used in, to retrieve those passwords. The Deploy to container Plugin
now integrates with Credentials Plugin to store passwords securely,
and automatically migrates existing passwords.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000114
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100223
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100223
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-08-07/

The Datadog Plugin stores an API key to access the Datadog service in
the global Jenkins configuration. While the API key is stored
encrypted on disk, it was transmitted in plain text as part of the
configuration form. This could result in exposure of the API key for
example through browser extensions or cross-site scripting
vulnerabilities. The Datadog Plugin now encrypts the API key
transmitted to administrators viewing the global configuration form.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000117
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:100283
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100283
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208103
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3934
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3934

Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42599/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-10
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-10
Reference: MISC:https://www.mail-archive.com/linux-kernel@vger.kernel.org/msg1466490.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2484
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2484
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2485
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2485
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2491
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2491
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2674
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2674
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2675
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2675
Reference: SECTRACK:1039131
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039131

A malicious third-party can give a crafted "ssh://..." URL to an
unsuspecting victim, and an attempt to visit the URL can result in any
program that exists on the victim's machine being executed. Such a URL
could be placed in the .gitmodules file of a malicious project, and an
unsuspecting victim could be tricked into running "git clone
--recurse-submodules" to trigger the vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000121
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171101)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/217126/webkit

The UNIX IPC layer in WebKit, including WebKitGTK+ prior to 2.16.3,
does not properly validate message size metadata, allowing a
compromised secondary process to trigger an integer overflow and
subsequent buffer overflow in the UI process. This vulnerability does
not affect Apple products.

Phase: Assigned(20171102)
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.launchpad.net/mahara/+bug/1508684

Mahara 15.04 before 15.04.8 and 15.10 before 15.10.4 and 16.04 before
16.04.2 are vulnerable to PHP code execution as Mahara would pass
portions of the XML through the PHP "unserialize()" function when
importing a skin from an XML file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000152
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171102)
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.launchpad.net/mahara/+bug/1570744

Mahara 15.04 before 15.04.7 and 15.10 before 15.10.3 running PHP 5.3
are vulnerable to one user being logged in as another user on a
separate computer as the same session ID is served. This situation can
occur when a user takes an action that forces another user to be
logged out of Mahara, such as an admin changing another user's account
settings.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: MISC:https://bugs.launchpad.net/mahara/+bug/1577251

16.04.4 are vulnerable to incorrect access control after the password
reset link is sent via email and then user changes default email,
Mahara fails to invalidate old link.Consequently the link in email can
be used to gain access to the user's account.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000172
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171116)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/marcobambini/gravity/issues/144

Creolabs Gravity Version: 1.0 Use-After-Free Possible code execution.
An example of a Heap-Use-After-Free after the 'sublexer' pointer has
been freed. Line 542 of gravity_lexer.c. 'lexer' is being used to
access a variable but 'lexer' has already been freed, creating a Heap
Use-After-Free condition.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000173
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171116)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/marcobambini/gravity/issues/172

Creolabs Gravity Version: 1.0 Heap Overflow Potential Code Execution.
By creating a large loop whiling pushing data to a buffer, we can
break out of the bounds checking of that buffer. When list.join is
called on the data it will read past a buffer resulting in a Heap-
Buffer-Overflow.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECTRACK:1038941
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038941

Vulnerability in the Oracle Hospitality Inventory Management component
of Oracle Hospitality Applications (subcomponent: Settings and
Config). Supported versions that are affected are 8.5.1 and 9.0.0.
Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with
network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle Hospitality Inventory
Management. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in
unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Oracle
Hospitality Inventory Management accessible data as well as
unauthorized read access to a subset of Oracle Hospitality Inventory
Management accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 5.4 (Confidentiality
and Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector:
(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000207
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171127)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-parser/pull/481
Reference: MISC:https://lgtm.com/blog/swagger_snakeyaml_CVE-2017-1000207_CVE-2017-1000208

A vulnerability in Swagger-Parser's version <= 1.0.30 and Swagger
codegen version <= 2.2.2 yaml parsing functionality results in
arbitrary code being executed when a maliciously crafted yaml Open-API
specification is parsed. This in particular, affects the 'generate'
and 'validate' command in swagger-codegen (<= 2.2.2) and can lead to
arbitrary code being executed when these commands are used on a well-
crafted yaml specification.

A vulnerability in Swagger-Parser's (version <= 1.0.30) yaml parsing
functionality results in arbitrary code being executed when a
maliciously crafted yaml Open-API specification is parsed. This in
particular, affects the 'generate' and 'validate' command in swagger-
codegen (<= 2.2.2) and can lead to arbitrary code being executed when
these commands are used on a well-crafted yaml specification.

Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/TakahikoKawasaki/nv-websocket-client/pull/107

The Java WebSocket client nv-websocket-client does not verify that the
server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name
(CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows
man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL/TLS servers via an arbitrary
valid certificate.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000221
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171117)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://opencast.jira.com/browse/MH-11862

In Opencast 2.2.3 and older if user names overlap, the Opencast search
service used for publication to the media modules and players will
handle the access control incorrectly so that users only need to match
part of the user name used for the access restriction. For example, a
user with the role ROLE_USER will have access to recordings published
only for ROLE_USER_X.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000253
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171003)
Reference: BID:101010
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101010
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/09/26/cve-2017-1000253/cve-2017-1000253.txt
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2793
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2793
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2794
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2794
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2795
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2795
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2796
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2796
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2797
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2797
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2798
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2798
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2799
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2799
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2800
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2800
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2801
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2801
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2802
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2802
Reference: SECTRACK:1039434
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039434

Linux distributions that have not patched their long-term kernels with
https://git.kernel.org/linus/a87938b2e246b81b4fb713edb371a9fa3c5c3c86
(committed on April 14, 2015). This kernel vulnerability was fixed in
April 2015 by commit a87938b2e246b81b4fb713edb371a9fa3c5c3c86
(backported to Linux 3.10.77 in May 2015), but it was not recognized
as a security threat. With CONFIG_ARCH_BINFMT_ELF_RANDOMIZE_PIE
enabled, and a normal top-down address allocation strategy,
load_elf_binary() will attempt to map a PIE binary into an address
range immediately below mm->mmap_base. Unfortunately, load_elf_
binary() does not take account of the need to allocate sufficient
space for the entire binary which means that, while the first PT_LOAD
segment is mapped below mm->mmap_base, the subsequent PT_LOAD
segment(s) end up being mapped above mm->mmap_base into the are that
is supposed to be the "gap" between the stack and the binary.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000254
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171006)
Reference: BID:101115
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101115
Reference: CONFIRM:https://curl.haxx.se/673d0cd8.patch
Reference: CONFIRM:https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_20171004.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208331
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3992
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3992
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201712-04
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201712-04
Reference: MLIST:[bookkeeper-issues] 20210628 [GitHub] [bookkeeper] padma81 opened a new issue #2746: Security Vulnerabilities in CentOS 7 image, Upgrade image to CentOS 8
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E
Reference: MLIST:[bookkeeper-issues] 20210629 [GitHub] [bookkeeper] padma81 opened a new issue #2746: Security Vulnerabilities in CentOS 7 image, Upgrade image to CentOS 8
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:2486
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:2486
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: SECTRACK:1039509
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039509

libcurl may read outside of a heap allocated buffer when doing FTP.
When libcurl connects to an FTP server and successfully logs in
(anonymous or not), it asks the server for the current directory with
the `PWD` command. The server then responds with a 257 response
containing the path, inside double quotes. The returned path name is
then kept by libcurl for subsequent uses. Due to a flaw in the string
parser for this directory name, a directory name passed like this but
without a closing double quote would lead to libcurl not adding a
trailing NUL byte to the buffer holding the name. When libcurl would
then later access the string, it could read beyond the allocated heap
buffer and crash or wrongly access data beyond the buffer, thinking it
was part of the path. A malicious server could abuse this fact and
effectively prevent libcurl-based clients to work with it - the PWD
command is always issued on new FTP connections and the mistake has a
high chance of causing a segfault. The simple fact that this has issue
remained undiscovered for this long could suggest that malformed PWD
responses are rare in benign servers. We are not aware of any exploit
of this flaw. This bug was introduced in commit
[415d2e7cb7](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/415d2e7cb7), March
2005. In libcurl version 7.56.0, the parser always zero terminates the
string but also rejects it if not terminated properly with a final
double quote.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000255
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171006)
Reference: BID:101264
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101264
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000255
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0654
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0654

On Linux running on PowerPC hardware (Power8 or later) a user process
can craft a signal frame and then do a sigreturn so that the kernel
will take an exception (interrupt), and use the r1 value *from the
signal frame* as the kernel stack pointer. As part of the exception
entry the content of the signal frame is written to the kernel stack,
allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary locations with arbitrary
values. The exception handling does produce an oops, and a panic if
panic_on_oops=1, but only after kernel memory has been over written.
This flaw was introduced in commit: "5d176f751ee3 (powerpc: tm: Enable
transactional memory (TM) lazily for userspace)" which was merged
upstream into v4.9-rc1. Please note that kernels built with
CONFIG_PPC_TRANSACTIONAL_MEM=n are not vulnerable.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000256
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171018)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000256
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4003

libvirt version 2.3.0 and later is vulnerable to a bad default
configuration of "verify-peer=no" passed to QEMU by libvirt resulting
in a failure to validate SSL/TLS certificates by default.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000257
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171031)
Reference: BID:101519
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101519
Reference: CONFIRM:https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_20171023.html
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4007
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-4007
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201712-04
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201712-04
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3263
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3263
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:2486
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:2486
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3558
Reference: SECTRACK:1039644
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039644

An IMAP FETCH response line indicates the size of the returned data,
in number of bytes. When that response says the data is zero bytes,
libcurl would pass on that (non-existing) data with a pointer and the
size (zero) to the deliver-data function. libcurl's deliver-data
function treats zero as a magic number and invokes strlen() on the
data to figure out the length. The strlen() is called on a heap based
buffer that might not be zero terminated so libcurl might read beyond
the end of it into whatever memory lies after (or just crash) and then
deliver that to the application as if it was actually downloaded.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-10003
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170621)
Reference: BID:99848
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99848
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpujul2017-3236622.html
Reference: SECTRACK:1038938
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038938

Vulnerability in the Solaris component of Oracle Sun Systems Products
Suite (subcomponent: Network Services Library). The supported version
that is affected is 10. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low
privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where Solaris
executes to compromise Solaris. Successful attacks of this
vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete
access to some of Solaris accessible data as well as unauthorized read
access to a subset of Solaris accessible data and unauthorized ability
to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of Solaris. CVSS
3.0 Base Score 4.5 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability
impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).


Current Votes:

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000353
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180129)
Reference: BID:98056
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/98056
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-04-26/
Reference: URL:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-04-26/
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:41965
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/41965/
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/159266/Jenkins-2.56-CLI-Deserialization-Code-Execution.html
Reference: URL:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/159266/Jenkins-2.56-CLI-Deserialization-Code-Execution.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html

Jenkins versions 2.56 and earlier as well as 2.46.1 LTS and earlier
are vulnerable to an unauthenticated remote code execution. An
unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability allowed attackers
to transfer a serialized Java `SignedObject` object to the Jenkins
CLI, that would be deserialized using a new `ObjectInputStream`,
bypassing the existing blacklist-based protection mechanism. We're
fixing this issue by adding `SignedObject` to the blacklist. We're
also backporting the new HTTP CLI protocol from Jenkins 2.54 to LTS
2.46.2, and deprecating the remoting-based (i.e. Java serialization)
CLI protocol, disabling it by default.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000354
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180129)
Reference: BID:98065
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/98065
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-04-26/

Jenkins versions 2.56 and earlier as well as 2.46.1 LTS and earlier
are vulnerable to a login command which allowed impersonating any
Jenkins user. The `login` command available in the remoting-based CLI
stored the encrypted user name of the successfully authenticated user
in a cache file used to authenticate further commands. Users with
sufficient permission to create secrets in Jenkins, and download their
encrypted values (e.g. with Job/Configure permission), were able to
impersonate any other Jenkins user on the same instance.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000362
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170710)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-02-01/

The re-key admin monitor was introduced in Jenkins 1.498 and re-
encrypted all secrets in JENKINS_HOME with a new key. It also created
a backup directory with all old secrets, and the key used to encrypt
them. These backups were world-readable and not removed afterwards.
Jenkins now deletes the backup directory, if present. Upgrading from
before 1.498 will no longer create a backup directory. Administrators
relying on file access permissions in their manually created backups
are advised to check them for the directory
$JENKINS_HOME/jenkins.security.RekeySecretAdminMonitor/backups, and
delete it if present.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000363
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170710)
Reference: BID:98651
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/98651
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3945
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3945
Reference: MISC:https://alephsecurity.com/vulns/aleph-2017023

Linux drivers/char/lp.c Out-of-Bounds Write. Due to a missing bounds
check, and the fact that parport_ptr integer is static, a 'secure
boot' kernel command line adversary (can happen due to bootloader
vulns, e.g. Google Nexus 6's CVE-2016-10277, where due to a
vulnerability the adversary has partial control over the command line)
can overflow the parport_nr array in the following code, by appending
many (>LP_NO) 'lp=none' arguments to the command line.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000364
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99130
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99130
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364

Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.suse.com/support/kb/doc/?id=7020973

Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:45625
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45625/
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1482
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1482
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1483
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1483
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1484
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1484
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1485
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1485
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1486
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1486
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1487
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1487
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1488
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1488
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1489
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1489
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1490
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1490
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1491
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1491
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1567
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1567
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1616
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1616
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1647
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1647
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1712
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1712
Reference: SECTRACK:1038724
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038724

An issue was discovered in the size of the stack guard page on Linux,
specifically a 4k stack guard page is not sufficiently large and can
be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is bypassed), this affects
Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier (the stackguard page was
introduced in 2010).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000365
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99156
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99156
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000365
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3927
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3927
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3945
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3945
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

The Linux Kernel imposes a size restriction on the arguments and
environmental strings passed through RLIMIT_STACK/RLIM_INFINITY (1/4
of the size), but does not take the argument and environment pointers
into account, which allows attackers to bypass this limitation. This
affects Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier. It appears that this
feature was introduced in the Linux Kernel version 2.6.23.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99127

Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3887
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3887

Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42276/
Reference: FULLDISC:20190904 SEC Consult SA-20190904-0 :: Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco router series RV34X, RV26X and RV16X
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Sep/7
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201706-19
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201706-19
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/154361/Cisco-Device-Hardcoded-Credentials-GNU-glibc-BusyBox.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1479
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1479
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1480
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1480
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1481
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1481
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1567
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1567
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:1712
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1712
Reference: SECTRACK:1038712
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038712

glibc contains a vulnerability that allows specially crafted
LD_LIBRARY_PATH values to manipulate the heap/stack, causing them to
alias, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution. Please note
that additional hardening changes have been made to glibc to prevent
manipulation of stack and heap memory but these issues are not
directly exploitable, as such they have not been given a CVE. This
affects glibc 2.25 and earlier.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000369
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99252
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99252
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000369
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3888
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3888
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-19
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-19
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Exim/exim/commit/65e061b76867a9ea7aeeb535341b790b90ae6c21
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt
Reference: SECTRACK:1038779
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038779

Exim supports the use of multiple "-p" command line arguments which
are malloc()'ed and never free()'ed, used in conjunction with other
issues allows attackers to cause arbitrary code execution. This
affects exim version 4.89 and earlier. Please note that at this time
upstream has released a patch (commit
65e061b76867a9ea7aeeb535341b790b90ae6c21), but it is not known if a
new point release is available that addresses this issue at this time.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000370
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99149
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99149
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000370
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3981
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3981
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:42273
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42273/
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:42274
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42274/
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

The offset2lib patch as used in the Linux Kernel contains a
vulnerability that allows a PIE binary to be execve()'ed with 1GB of
arguments or environmental strings then the stack occupies the address
0x80000000 and the PIE binary is mapped above 0x40000000 nullifying
the protection of the offset2lib patch. This affects Linux Kernel
version 4.11.5 and earlier. This is a different issue than
CVE-2017-1000371. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based
systems.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000371
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99131
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3981
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3981
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:42273
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42273/
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:42276
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42276/
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a
vulnerability, if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte
of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then
the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000, and as the PIE binary is
mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the
PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes
small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an
attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a
different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue
appears to be limited to i386 based systems.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000372
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99172
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99172
Reference: MISC:https://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/6.1/common/008_exec_subr.patch.sig
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

A flaw exists in OpenBSD's implementation of the stack guard page that
allows attackers to bypass it resulting in arbitrary code execution
using setuid binaries such as /usr/bin/at. This affects OpenBSD 6.1
and possibly earlier versions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000373
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99177
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99177
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208112
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208113
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208115
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208144
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:42271
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42271/
Reference: MISC:https://cvsweb.openbsd.org/cgi-bin/cvsweb/src/lib/libc/stdlib/qsort.c?rev=1.15&content-type=text/x-cvsweb-markup
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt
Reference: SECTRACK:1039427
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039427

The OpenBSD qsort() function is recursive, and not randomized, an
attacker can construct a pathological input array of N elements that
causes qsort() to deterministically recurse N/4 times. This allows
attackers to consume arbitrary amounts of stack memory and manipulate
stack memory to assist in arbitrary code execution attacks. This
affects OpenBSD 6.1 and possibly earlier versions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000374
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99176
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99176
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

A flaw exists in NetBSD's implementation of the stack guard page that
allows attackers to bypass it resulting in arbitrary code execution
using certain setuid binaries. This affects NetBSD 7.1 and possibly
earlier versions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000375
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99257
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99257
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:42272
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42272/
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

NetBSD maps the run-time link-editor ld.so directly below the stack
region, even if ASLR is enabled, this allows attackers to more easily
manipulate memory leading to arbitrary code execution. This affects
NetBSD 7.1 and possibly earlier versions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000376
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000376
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3889
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3889
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

libffi requests an executable stack allowing attackers to more easily
trigger arbitrary code execution by overwriting the stack. Please note
that libffi is used by a number of other libraries. It was previously
stated that this affects libffi version 3.2.1 but this appears to be
incorrect. libffi prior to version 3.1 on 32 bit x86 systems was
vulnerable, and upstream is believed to have fixed this issue in
version 3.1.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000377
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170619)
Reference: BID:99129
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99129
Reference: CONFIRM:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000377
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

An issue was discovered in the size of the default stack guard page on
PAX Linux (originally from GRSecurity but shipped by other Linux
vendors), specifically the default stack guard page is not
sufficiently large and can be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is
bypassed), this affects PAX Linux Kernel versions as of June 19, 2017
(specific version information is not available at this time).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000378
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170613)
Reference: BID:99255
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99255
Reference: MISC:http://cvsweb.netbsd.org/bsdweb.cgi/src/lib/libc/stdlib/qsort.c?rev=1.23&content-type=text/x-cvsweb-markup
Reference: MISC:https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt

The NetBSD qsort() function is recursive, and not randomized, an
attacker can construct a pathological input array of N elements that
causes qsort() to deterministically recurse N/4 times. This allows
attackers to consume arbitrary amounts of stack memory and manipulate
stack memory to assist in arbitrary code execution attacks. This
affects NetBSD 7.1 and possibly earlier versions.

The Linux Kernel running on AMD64 systems will sometimes map the
contents of PIE executable, the heap or ld.so to where the stack is

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000380
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170613)
Reference: BID:99121
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99121
Reference: CONFIRM:https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/pixel/2017-12-01
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3981
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3981
Reference: MISC:http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=ba3021b2c79b2fa9114f92790a99deb27a65b728

Reference: MISC:http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v4.x/ChangeLog-4.11.5
Reference: MISC:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/06/12/2
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/ba3021b2c79b2fa9114f92790a99deb27a65b728
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/d11662f4f798b50d8c8743f433842c3e40fe3378
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3295
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3295
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3315
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3315
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3322
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3322

sound/core/timer.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11.5 is vulnerable to
a data race in the ALSA /dev/snd/timer driver resulting in local users
being able to read information belonging to other users, i.e.,
uninitialized memory contents may be disclosed when a read and an
ioctl happen at the same time.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000381
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170707)
Reference: BID:99148
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99148
Reference: CONFIRM:https://c-ares.haxx.se/0616.patch
Reference: CONFIRM:https://c-ares.haxx.se/adv_20170620.html

The c-ares function `ares_parse_naptr_reply()`, which is used for
parsing NAPTR responses, could be triggered to read memory outside of
the given input buffer if the passed in DNS response packet was
crafted in a particular way.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000382
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171031)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://security.cucumberlinux.com/security/details.php?id=120
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20171031 Fw: Security risk of vim swap files
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/10/31/1

VIM version 8.0.1187 (and other versions most likely) ignores umask
when creating a swap file ("[ORIGINAL_FILENAME].swp") resulting in
files that may be world readable or otherwise accessible in ways not
intended by the user running the vi binary.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

Status: Candidate

Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20171031 Fw: Security risk of vim swap files
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/10/31/1

GNU Emacs version 25.3.1 (and other versions most likely) ignores
umask when creating a backup save file ("[ORIGINAL_FILENAME]~")
resulting in files that may be world readable or otherwise accessible
in ways not intended by the user running the emacs binary.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000385
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: BID:102197
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102197
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#144389
Reference: URL:https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/144389
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4057
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-4057
Reference: MISC:https://robotattack.org/
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20171215 [SECURITY] [DLA 1207-1] erlang security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2017/12/msg00010.html
Reference: MLIST:[erlang-questions] 20171123 Patch Package: OTP 18.3.4.7
Reference: URL:http://erlang.org/pipermail/erlang-questions/2017-November/094257.html
Reference: MLIST:[erlang-questions] 20171123 Patch Package: OTP 19.3.6.4
Reference: URL:http://erlang.org/pipermail/erlang-questions/2017-November/094256.html
Reference: MLIST:[erlang-questions] 20171123 Patch Package: OTP 20.1.7
Reference: URL:http://erlang.org/pipermail/erlang-questions/2017-November/094255.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0242
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0242
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0303
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0303
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0368
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0368
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0528
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0528
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3571-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3571-1/

The Erlang otp TLS server answers with different TLS alerts to
different error types in the RSA PKCS #1 1.5 padding. This allows an
attacker to decrypt content or sign messages with the server's private
key (this is a variation of the Bleichenbacher attack).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000386
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: BID:101538
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101538
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-23/

Jenkins Active Choices plugin version 1.5.3 and earlier allowed users
with Job/Configure permission to provide arbitrary HTML to be shown on
the 'Build With Parameters' page through the 'Active Choices Reactive
Reference Parameter' type. This could include, for example, arbitrary
JavaScript. Active Choices now sanitizes the HTML inserted on the
'Build With Parameters' page if and only if the script is executed in
a sandbox. As unsandboxed scripts are subject to administrator
approval, it is up to the administrator to allow or disallow
problematic script output.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000387
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: BID:101544
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101544
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-23/

Jenkins Build-Publisher plugin version 1.21 and earlier stores
credentials to other Jenkins instances in the file
hudson.plugins.build_publisher.BuildPublisher.xml in the Jenkins
master home directory. These credentials were stored unencrypted,
allowing anyone with local file system access to access them.
Additionally, the credentials were also transmitted in plain text as
part of the configuration form. This could result in exposure of the
credentials through browser extensions, cross-site scripting
vulnerabilities, and similar situations.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-23/

Jenkins Dependency Graph Viewer plugin 0.12 and earlier did not
perform permission checks for the API endpoint that modifies the
dependency graph, allowing anyone with Overall/Read permission to
modify this data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000389
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-23/

Some URLs provided by Jenkins global-build-stats plugin version 1.4
and earlier returned a JSON response that contained request
parameters. These responses had the Content Type: text/html, so could
have been interpreted as HTML by clients, resulting in a potential
reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability. Additionally, some URLs
provided by global-build-stats plugin that modify data did not require
POST requests to be sent, resulting in a potential cross-site request
forgery vulnerability.

permissions in the Resume Build action, allowing anyone with Job/Read

Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-11-08/

Jenkins versions 2.88 and earlier and 2.73.2 and earlier stores
metadata related to 'people', which encompasses actual user accounts,
as well as users appearing in SCM, in directories corresponding to the
user ID on disk. These directories used the user ID for their name
without additional escaping, potentially resulting in problems like
overwriting of unrelated configuration files.

suggestions for text fields were not escaped, resulting in a persisted

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000393
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier users with permission to
create or configure agents in Jenkins could configure a launch method
called 'Launch agent via execution of command on master'. This allowed
them to run arbitrary shell commands on the master node whenever the
agent was supposed to be launched. Configuration of this launch method
now requires the Run Scripts permission typically only granted to
administrators.

commons-fileupload library with the denial-of-service vulnerability
known as CVE-2016-3092. The fix for that vulnerability has been
backported to the version of the library bundled with Jenkins.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000395
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier provides information
about Jenkins user accounts which is generally available to anyone
with Overall/Read permissions via the /user/(username)/api remote API.
This included e.g. Jenkins users' email addresses if the Mailer Plugin
is installed. The remote API now no longer includes information beyond
the most basic (user ID and name) unless the user requesting it is a
Jenkins administrator.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000396
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier bundled a version of the
commons-httpclient library with the vulnerability CVE-2012-6153 that
incorrectly verified SSL certificates, making it susceptible to man-
in-the-middle attacks. This library is widely used as a transitive
dependency in Jenkins plugins. The fix for CVE-2012-6153 was
backported to the version of commons-httpclient that is bundled in
core and made available to plugins.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

Jenkins Maven Plugin 2.17 and earlier bundled a version of the
commons-httpclient library with the vulnerability CVE-2012-6153 that
incorrectly verified SSL certificates, making it susceptible to man-
in-the-middle attacks. Maven Plugin 3.0 no longer has a dependency on
commons-httpclient.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000398
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

The remote API in Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier at
/computer/(agent-name)/api showed information about tasks (typically
builds) currently running on that agent. This included information
about tasks that the current user otherwise has no access to, e.g. due
to lack of Item/Read permission. This has been fixed, and the API now
only shows information about accessible tasks.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000399
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

The Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier remote API at
/queue/item/(ID)/api showed information about tasks in the queue
(typically builds waiting to start). This included information about
tasks that the current user otherwise has no access to, e.g. due to
lack of Item/Read permission. This has been fixed, and the API
endpoint is now only available for tasks that the current user has
access to.

======================================================

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000400
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

The Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier remote API at
/job/(job-name)/api contained information about upstream and
downstream projects. This included information about tasks that the
current user otherwise has no access to, e.g. due to lack of Item/Read
permission. This has been fixed, and the API now only lists upstream
and downstream projects that the current user has access to.


Current Votes:

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000401
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2017-10-11/

The Jenkins 2.73.1 and earlier, 2.83 and earlier default form control
for passwords and other secrets, <f:password/>, supports form
validation (e.g. for API keys). The form validation AJAX requests were
sent via GET, which could result in secrets being logged to a HTTP
access log in non-default configurations of Jenkins, and made
available to users with access to these log files. Form validation for
<f:password/> is now always sent via POST, which is typically not
logged.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000405
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171129)
Reference: BID:102032
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102032
Reference: CONFIRM:https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/pixel/2018-02-01
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:43199
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43199/
Reference: MISC:https://medium.com/bindecy/huge-dirty-cow-cve-2017-1000405-110eca132de0
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0180
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0180
Reference: SECTRACK:1040020
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040020

The Linux Kernel versions 2.6.38 through 4.14 have a problematic use
of pmd_mkdirty() in the touch_pmd() function inside the THP
implementation. touch_pmd() can be reached by get_user_pages(). In
such case, the pmd will become dirty. This scenario breaks the new
can_follow_write_pmd()'s logic - pmd can become dirty without going
through a COW cycle. This bug is not as severe as the original "Dirty
cow" because an ext4 file (or any other regular file) cannot be mapped
using THP. Nevertheless, it does allow us to overwrite read-only huge
pages. For example, the zero huge page and sealed shmem files can be
overwritten (since their mapping can be populated using THP). Note
that after the first write page-fault to the zero page, it will be
replaced with a new fresh (and zeroed) thp.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000406

Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q4/320

OpenDaylight Karaf 0.6.1-Carbon fails to clear the cache after a
password change, allowing the old password to be used until the Karaf
cache is manually cleared (e.g. via restart).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000408
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171205)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:43331
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43331/
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20171211 Qualys Security Advisory - Buffer overflow in glibc's ld.so
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q4/385
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20190627 Re: linux-distros membership application - Microsoft
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/06/27/7
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20190628 Re: linux-distros membership application - Microsoft
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/06/28/1

Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/06/28/2

A memory leak in glibc 2.1.1 (released on May 24, 1999) can be reached
and amplified through the LD_HWCAP_MASK environment variable. Please
note that many versions of glibc are not vulnerable to this issue if
patched for CVE-2017-1000366.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000409
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171205)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190404-0003/
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:43331
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43331/

can be triggered through the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable.
Please note that many versions of glibc are not vulnerable to this
issue if patched for CVE-2017-1000366.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000410
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171207)
Reference: BID:102101
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102101
Reference: CONFIRM:https://help.ecostruxureit.com/display/public/UADCE725/Security+fixes+in+StruxureWare+Data+Center+Expert+v7.6.0
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4073
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-4073
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4082
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4082
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20171206 Info Leak in the Linux Kernel via Bluetooth
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q4/357
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0654
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0654
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0676
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0676
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:1062
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1062
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:1130
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1130
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:1170
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1170
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:1319
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1319
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3933-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3933-1/
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3933-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3933-2/

The Linux kernel version 3.3-rc1 and later is affected by a
vulnerability lies in the processing of incoming L2CAP commands -
ConfigRequest, and ConfigResponse messages. This info leak is a result
of uninitialized stack variables that may be returned to an attacker
in their uninitialized state. By manipulating the code flows that
precede the handling of these configuration messages, an attacker can
also gain some control over which data will be held in the
uninitialized stack variables. This can allow him to bypass KASLR, and
stack canaries protection - as both pointers and stack canaries may be
leaked in this manner. Combining this vulnerability (for example) with
the previously disclosed RCE vulnerability in L2CAP configuration
parsing (CVE-2017-1000251) may allow an attacker to exploit the RCE
against kernels which were built with the above mitigations. These are
the specifics of this vulnerability: In the function
l2cap_parse_conf_rsp and in the function l2cap_parse_conf_req the
following variable is declared without initialization: struct
l2cap_conf_efs efs; In addition, when parsing input configuration
parameters in both of these functions, the switch case for handling
EFS elements may skip the memcpy call that will write to the efs
variable: ... case L2CAP_CONF_EFS: if (olen == sizeof(efs))
memcpy(&efs, (void *)val, olen); ... The olen in the above if is
attacker controlled, and regardless of that if, in both of these
functions the efs variable would eventually be added to the outgoing
configuration request that is being built: l2cap_add_conf_opt(&ptr,
L2CAP_CONF_EFS, sizeof(efs), (unsigned long) &efs); So by sending a
configuration request, or response, that contains an L2CAP_CONF_EFS
element, but with an element length that is not sizeof(efs) - the
memcpy to the uninitialized efs variable can be avoided, and the
uninitialized variable would be returned to the attacker (16 bytes).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000411
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20171228)
Reference: BID:102736
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102736
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20180116 opendaylight-advisory: Multiple "expired" flows consume the memory resource of CONFIG DS
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2018/q1/52

OpenFlow Plugin and OpenDayLight Controller versions Nitrogen, Carbon,
Boron, Robert Varga, Anil Vishnoi contain a flaw when multiple
'expired' flows take up the memory resource of CONFIG DATASTORE which
leads to CONTROLLER shutdown. If multiple different flows with 'idle-
timeout' and 'hard-timeout' are sent to the Openflow Plugin REST API,
the expired flows will eventually crash the controller once its
resource allocations set with the JVM size are exceeded. Although the
installed flows (with timeout set) are removed from network (and thus
also from controller's operations DS), the expired entries are still
present in CONFIG DS. The attack can originate both from NORTH or
SOUTH. The above description is for a north bound attack. A south
bound attack can originate when an attacker attempts a flow flooding
attack and since flows come with timeouts, the attack is not
successful. However, the attacker will now be successful in CONTROLLER
overflow attack (resource consumption). Although, the network (actual
flow tables) and operational DS are only (~)1% occupied, the
controller requests for resource consumption. This happens because the
installed flows get removed from the network upon timeout.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000412
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180102)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/OP-TEE/optee_os/blob/2.5.0/CHANGELOG.md

Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.op-tee.org/security-advisories/

Linaro's open source TEE solution called OP-TEE, version 2.4.0 (and
older) is vulnerable to the bellcore attack in the LibTomCrypt code
resulting in compromised private RSA key.

in OP-TEE resulting in a compromised private RSA key.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000414
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180125)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/ImpulseAdventure/JPEGsnoop/commit/b4e458612d4294e0cfe01dbf1c0b09a07a8133a4#diff-cf9182aecc9d630e8db2e0e35f1eec65
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.impulseadventure.com/photo/jpeg-snoop-history.html

ImpulseAdventure JPEGsnoop version 1.7.5 is vulnerable to a division
by zero in the JFIF decode handling resulting denial of service.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000450
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180102)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/blendin/pocs/blob/master/opencv/0.OOB_Write_FillUniColor

overflow. If the image is from remote, may lead to remote code
execution or denial of service. This affects Opencv 3.3 and earlier.

buildCommand method used to construct exec strings does not properly
sanitize data and is vulnerable to command injection across all

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000460
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180103)
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.libav.org/show_bug.cgi?id=952
Reference: MISC:https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/third_party/ffmpeg/+/8e313ca08800178efce00045e07dc494d437b70c
Reference: MISC:https://lists.ffmpeg.org/pipermail/ffmpeg-cvslog/2017-January/104221.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20190330 [SECURITY] [DLA 1740-1] libav security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00041.html

In line libavcodec/h264dec.c:500 in libav(v13_dev0), ffmpeg(n3.4),
chromium(56 prior Feb 13, 2017), the return value of init_get_bits is
ignored and get_ue_golomb(&gb) is called on an uninitialized get_bits
context, which causes a NULL deref exception.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000472
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180103)
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4083
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4083
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pocoproject/poco/issues/1968
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180110 [SECURITY] [DLA 1239-1] poco security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/01/msg00013.html

The ZipCommon::isValidPath() function in Zip/src/ZipCommon.cpp in POCO
C++ Libraries before 1.8 does not properly restrict the filename value
in the ZIP header, which allows attackers to conduct absolute path
traversal attacks during the ZIP decompression, and possibly create or
overwrite arbitrary files, via a crafted ZIP file, related to a "file
path injection vulnerability".

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000479
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20180103)
Reference: MISC:https://doc.pfsense.org/index.php/2.4.2_New_Features_and_Changes
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/opnsense/core/commit/d218b225
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/pfsense/pfsense/commit/386d89b07
Reference: MISC:https://www.netgate.com/blog/pfsense-2-4-2-release-p1-and-2-3-5-release-p1-now-available.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.securify.nl/en/advisory/SFY20171101/clickjacking-vulnerability-in-csrf-error-page-pfsense.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20171122 Clickjacking vulnerability in CSRF error page pfSense
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/22/7

pfSense versions 2.4.1 and lower are vulnerable to clickjacking
attacks in the CSRF error page resulting in privileged execution of
arbitrary code, because the error detection occurs before an X-Frame-
Options header is set. This is fixed in 2.4.2-RELEASE. OPNsense, a
2015 fork of pfSense, was not vulnerable since version 16.1.16
released on June 06, 2016. The unprotected web form was removed from
the code during an internal security audit under "possibly insecure"
suspicions.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1000480
Status: Candidate

Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4094
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4094
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/smarty-php/smarty/blob/master/change_log.txt
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180119 [SECURITY] [DLA 1249-1] smarty3 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/01/msg00023.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180201 [SECURITY] [DLA 1249-2] smarty3 regression update
