======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-10998
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170707)
Reference: BID:100658
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100658
Reference: CONFIRM:https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2017-09-01

In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the
Linux kernel, in audio_aio_ion_lookup_vaddr, the buffer length, which
is user input, ends up being used to validate if the buffer is fully
within the valid region. If the buffer length is large enough then the
address + length operation could overflow and produce a result far
below the valid region.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the probe requests
originated from user's phone contains the information elements which
specifies the supported wifi features. This shall impact the user's
privacy if someone sniffs the probe requests originated by this DUT.

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170707)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/pixel/2017-11-01

In android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, with all Android

"user-memory-access" issue as the Camera CPP module Linux driver
directly accesses the application provided buffer, which resides in

copy contents to a kernel buffer which can lead to kernel buffer
overflow.

Reference: CONFIRM:https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/pixel/2018-01-01

In Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, with all Android
releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, while processing a user
supplied sparse image, a buffer overflow vulnerability could occur if
the sparse header block size is equal to 4294967296.


Current Votes:

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11081
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170707)

overflow vulnerability in hdd_parse_setrmcenable_command and

copied.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11103
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170707)
Reference: BID:99551
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99551
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.h5l.org/advisories.html?show=2017-07-11
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/heimdal/heimdal/releases/tag/heimdal-7.4.0
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208112
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208144
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208221
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-11103.html
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3912
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3912
Reference: FREEBSD:FreeBSD-SA-17:05
Reference: URL:https://www.freebsd.org/security/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-17:05.heimdal.asc
Reference: MISC:https://www.orpheus-lyre.info/
Reference: SECTRACK:1038876
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038876
Reference: SECTRACK:1039427
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039427

Heimdal before 7.4 allows remote attackers to impersonate services
with Orpheus' Lyre attacks because it obtains service-principal names
in a way that violates the Kerberos 5 protocol specification. In
_krb5_extract_ticket() the KDC-REP service name must be obtained from
the encrypted version stored in 'enc_part' instead of the unencrypted
version stored in 'ticket'. Use of the unencrypted version provides an
opportunity for successful server impersonation and other attacks.
NOTE: this CVE is only for Heimdal and other products that embed
Heimdal code; it does not apply to other instances in which this part
of the Kerberos 5 protocol specification is violated.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11104
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170708)
Reference: BID:99598
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99598
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3910
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3910
Reference: MISC:http://www.synacktiv.ninja/ressources/Knot_DNS_TSIG_Signature_Forgery.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.debian.org/865678
Reference: MISC:https://lists.nic.cz/pipermail/knot-dns-users/2017-June/001144.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1085
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00076.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1086
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00078.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1112
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00089.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1232
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00049.html

Knot DNS before 2.4.5 and 2.5.x before 2.5.2 contains a flaw within
the TSIG protocol implementation that would allow an attacker with a
valid key name and algorithm to bypass TSIG authentication if no
additional ACL restrictions are set, because of an improper TSIG
validity period check.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: MISC:https://alephsecurity.com/vulns/aleph-2017026

The OnePlus 2 Primary Bootloader (PBL) does not validate the SBL1
partition before executing it, although it contains a certificate.
This allows attackers with write access to that partition to disable
signature validation.

Reference: CONFIRM:https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2017-09-01
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208112
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT208113
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT208112
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT208113
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/144329/Broadcom-802.11r-FT-Reassociation-Response-Overflows.html
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=1291

On Broadcom BCM4355C0 Wi-Fi chips 9.44.78.27.0.1.56 and other chips,
properly crafted malicious over-the-air Fast Transition frames can
potentially trigger internal Wi-Fi firmware heap and/or stack
overflows, leading to denial of service or other effects, aka
B-V2017061205.


Current Votes:

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11130
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat through 1.7.5 for
Android, through 0.0.80w for Web, and through 0.0.86 for Desktop. The
product's protocol only tries to ensure confidentiality. In the whole
protocol, no integrity or authenticity checks are done. Therefore man-
in-the-middle attackers can conduct replay attacks.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11131
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat through 1.7.5 for
Android, through 0.0.80w for Web, and through 0.0.86 for Desktop. For
authentication, the user password is hashed directly with SHA-512
without a salt or another key-derivation mechanism to enable a secure
secret for authentication. Moreover, only the first 32 bytes of the
hash are used. This allows for easy dictionary and rainbow-table
attacks if an attacker has access to the password hash.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11132
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat before 1.5.18 for
Android. No certificate pinning is implemented; therefore the attacker
could issue a certificate for the backend and the application would
not notice it.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11133
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat through 1.7.5 for
Android, through 0.0.80w for Web, and through 0.0.86 for Desktop. To
encrypt messages, AES in CBC mode is used with a pseudo-random secret.
This secret and the IV are generated with math.random() in previous
versions and with CryptoJS.lib.WordArray.random() in newer versions,
which uses math.random() internally. This is not cryptographically
strong.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11134
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat through 1.7.5 for
Android. The login credentials are written into a log file on the
device. Hence, an attacker with access to the logs can read them.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11135
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat through 1.7.5 for
Android, through 0.0.80w for Web, and through 0.0.86 for Desktop. The
logout mechanism does not check for authorization. Therefore, an
attacker only needs to know the device ID. This causes a denial of
service. This might be interpreted as a vulnerability in customer-
controlled software, in the sense that the StashCat client side has no
secure way to signal that it is ending a session and that data should
be deleted.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11136
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170709)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/90

An issue was discovered in heinekingmedia StashCat through 1.7.5 for
Android, through 0.0.80w for Web, and through 0.0.86 for Desktop. It
uses RSA to exchange a secret for symmetric encryption of messages.
However, the private RSA key is not only stored on the client but
transmitted to the backend, too. Moreover, the key to decrypt the
private key is composed of the first 32 bytes of the SHA-512 hash of
the user password. But this hash is stored on the backend, too.
Therefore, everyone with access to the backend database can read the
transmitted secret for symmetric encryption, hence can read the
communication.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

bd77ac90d3bdf31ce2a5251ad92e9e75 gist.

======================================================

Status: Candidate

Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11171
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170711)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1025068
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/GNOME/gnome-session/commit/b0dc999e0b45355314616321dbb6cb71e729fc9d

Bad reference counting in the context of accept_ice_connection() in
gsm-xsmp-server.c in old versions of gnome-session up until version
2.29.92 allows a local attacker to establish ICE connections to gnome-
session with invalid authentication data (an invalid magic cookie).
Each failed authentication attempt will leak a file descriptor in
gnome-session. When the maximum number of file descriptors is
exhausted in the gnome-session process, it will enter an infinite loop
trying to communicate without success, consuming 100% of the CPU. The
graphical session associated with the gnome-session process will stop
working correctly, because communication with gnome-session is no
longer possible.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Missing anchor in generated regex for rack-cors before 0.4.1 allows a

configuration were intended to allow only the trusted example.com
domain name and not the malicious example.net domain name, then
example.com.example.net (as well as example.com-example.net) would be
inadvertently allowed.

the sock pointer to NULL upon entry into the retry logic. During a
user-space close of a Netlink socket, it allows attackers to cause a
denial of service (use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified other
impact.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11193
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170712)
Reference: BID:99621
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99621
Reference: MISC:http://www.sxcurity.pro/Multiple%20XSS%20and%20CSRF%20in%20Pulse%20Connect%20Secure%20v8.3R1.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://twitter.com/sxcurity/status/884556905145937921

Pulse Connect Secure 8.3R1 has CSRF in diag.cgi. In the panel, the
diag.cgi file is responsible for running commands such as ping, ping6,
traceroute, traceroute6, nslookup, arp, and Portprobe. These functions
do not have any protections against CSRF. That can allow an attacker
to run these commands against any IP if they can get an admin to visit
their malicious CSRF page.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11194
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170712)
Reference: MISC:http://www.sxcurity.pro/Multiple%20XSS%20and%20CSRF%20in%20Pulse%20Connect%20Secure%20v8.3R1.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://twitter.com/sxcurity/status/884556905145937921

Pulse Connect Secure 8.3R1 has Reflected XSS in
adminservercacertdetails.cgi. In the admin panel, the certid parameter
of adminservercacertdetails.cgi is reflected in the application's
response and is not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to inject
tags. An attacker could come up with clever payloads to make the
system run commands such as ping, ping6, traceroute, nslookup, arp,
etc.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11195
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170712)
Reference: BID:99615
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99615
Reference: MISC:http://www.sxcurity.pro/Multiple%20XSS%20and%20CSRF%20in%20Pulse%20Connect%20Secure%20v8.3R1.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://twitter.com/sxcurity/status/884556905145937921

Pulse Connect Secure 8.3R1 has Reflected XSS in launchHelp.cgi. The
helpLaunchPage parameter is reflected in an IFRAME element, if the
value contains two quotes. It properly sanitizes quotes and tags, so
one cannot simply close the src with a quote and inject after that.
However, an attacker can use javascript: or data: to abuse this.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11196
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170712)
Reference: BID:99613
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99613
Reference: MISC:http://www.sxcurity.pro/Multiple%20XSS%20and%20CSRF%20in%20Pulse%20Connect%20Secure%20v8.3R1.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://twitter.com/sxcurity/status/884556905145937921

Pulse Connect Secure 8.3R1 has CSRF in logout.cgi. The logout function
of the admin panel is not protected by any CSRF tokens, thus allowing
an attacker to logout a user by making them visit a malicious web
page.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11213
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170713)
Reference: BID:101837
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101837
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsb17-33.html
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201711-13
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201711-13
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3222
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3222
Reference: SECTRACK:1039778
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039778

An issue was discovered in Adobe Flash Player 27.0.0.183 and earlier
versions. This vulnerability occurs as a result of a computation that
reads data that is past the end of the target buffer due to an integer
overflow; the computation is part of the abstraction that creates an
arbitrarily sized transparent or opaque bitmap image. The use of an
invalid (out-of-range) pointer offset during access of internal data
structure fields causes the vulnerability. A successful attack can
lead to sensitive data exposure.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11215
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170713)
Reference: BID:101837
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101837
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsb17-33.html
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201711-13
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201711-13
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3222
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3222
Reference: SECTRACK:1039778
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039778

An issue was discovered in Adobe Flash Player 27.0.0.183 and earlier
versions. This vulnerability is an instance of a use after free
vulnerability in the Primetime SDK. The mismatch between an old and a
new object can provide an attacker with unintended memory access --
potentially leading to code corruption, control-flow hijack, or an
information leak attack. Successful exploitation could lead to
arbitrary code execution.

earlier, 2015.006.30306 and earlier, and 11.0.20 and earlier has an
exploitable memory corruption vulnerability in the image conversion
engine when processing Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) private JPEG
data. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution.

POST request to /actionphp/action.input.php with the id parameter.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11335
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170715)

Reference: MISC:http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2715
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3602-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3602-1/

There is a heap based buffer overflow in tools/tiff2pdf.c of LibTIFF
4.0.8 via a PlanarConfig=Contig image, which causes a more than one
hundred bytes out-of-bounds write (related to the ZIPDecode function
in tif_zip.c). A crafted input may lead to a remote denial of service
attack or an arbitrary code execution attack.

Name: CVE-2017-11343
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170716)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/chicken-announce/2017-07/msg00000.html

Scheme up to and including 4.12.0 are vulnerable to an algorithmic
complexity attack. An attacker can provide crafted input which, when
inserted into the symbol table, will result in O(n) lookup time.

RT-AC55U, RT-AC52U, RT-AC51U, RT-N18U, RT-N66U, RT-N56U, RT-AC3200,
RT-AC3100, RT_AC1200GU, RT_AC1200G, RT-AC1200, RT-AC53, RT-N12HP,
RT-N12HP_B1, RT-N12D1, RT-N12+, RT_N12+_PRO, RT-N16, and RT-N300
devices allows remote attackers to write shellcode at any address in
the heap; this can be used to execute arbitrary code on the router by
hosting a crafted device description XML document at a URL specified
within a Location header in an SSDP response.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11345
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170716)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://asuswrt.lostrealm.ca/changelog
Reference: MISC:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/14/3

Stack buffer overflow in networkmap in Asuswrt-Merlin firmware for
ASUS devices and ASUS firmware for ASUS RT-AC5300, RT_AC1900P, RT-
AC68U, RT-AC68P, RT-AC88U, RT-AC66U, RT-AC66U_B1, RT-AC58U, RT-AC56U,
RT-AC55U, RT-AC52U, RT-AC51U, RT-N18U, RT-N66U, RT-N56U, RT-AC3200,
RT-AC3100, RT_AC1200GU, RT_AC1200G, RT-AC1200, RT-AC53, RT-N12HP,
RT-N12HP_B1, RT-N12D1, RT-N12+, RT_N12+_PRO, RT-N16, and RT-N300
devices allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the
router by hosting a crafted device description XML document (that
includes a serviceType element) at a URL specified within a Location
header in an SSDP response.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11362
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170716)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20180112-0001/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-21
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-21

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:1296
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1296
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3566-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3566-2/

In PHP 7.x before 7.0.21 and 7.1.x before 7.1.7,
ext/intl/msgformat/msgformat_parse.c does not restrict the locale
length, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(stack-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have
unspecified other impact within International Components for Unicode
(ICU) for C/C++ via a long first argument to the msgfmt_parse_message
function.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11399
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: BID:100019
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100019
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/ba4beaf6149f7241c8bd85fe853318c2f6837ad0
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3957
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3957
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/96349da5ec8eda9f0368446e557fe0c8ba0e66b7

Integer overflow in the ape_decode_frame function in
libavcodec/apedec.c in FFmpeg 2.4 through 3.3.2 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-array access and
application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a
crafted APE file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11400
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/airbus-seclab/security-advisories/blob/master/belden/tofino.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.belden.com/hubfs/support/security/bulletins/Belden-Security-Bulletin-BSECV-2017-14-1v1-1.pdf

An issue has been discovered on the Belden Hirschmann Tofino Xenon
Security Appliance before 03.2.00. An incomplete firmware signature
allows a local attacker to upgrade the equipment (kernel, file system)
with unsigned, attacker-controlled, data. This occurs because the
appliance_config file is signed but the .tar.sec file is unsigned.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11401
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/airbus-seclab/security-advisories/blob/master/belden/tofino.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.belden.com/hubfs/support/security/bulletins/Belden-Security-Bulletin-BSECV-2017-14-1v1-1.pdf

An issue has been discovered on the Belden Hirschmann Tofino Xenon
Security Appliance before 03.2.00. Improper handling of the
mbap.length field of ModBus packets in the ModBus DPI filter allows an
attacker to send malformed/crafted packets to a protected asset,
bypassing function code filtering.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11402
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/airbus-seclab/security-advisories/blob/master/belden/tofino.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.belden.com/hubfs/support/security/bulletins/Belden-Security-Bulletin-BSECV-2017-14-1v1-1.pdf

An issue has been discovered on the Belden Hirschmann Tofino Xenon
Security Appliance before 03.2.00. Design flaws in OPC classic and in
custom netfilter modules allow an attacker to remotely activate rules
on the firewall and to connect to any TCP port of a protected asset,
thus bypassing the firewall. The attack methodology is a crafted OPC
dynamic port shift.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

The ReadMNGImage function in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has
an out-of-order CloseBlob call, resulting in a use-after-free via a
crafted file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11406
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: BID:99903
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99903
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=13797
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=250216263c3a3f2c651e80d9c6b3dc0adc53dc2c
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2017-36.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20190115 [SECURITY] [DLA 1634-1] wireshark security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00010.html
Reference: SECTRACK:1038966
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038966

In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.7 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.13, the DOCSIS dissector
could go into an infinite loop. This was addressed in
plugins/docsis/packet-docsis.c by rejecting invalid Frame Control
parameter values.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11410
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=13796
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=3c7168cc5f044b4da8747d35da0b2b204dabf398
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2017-13.html

In Wireshark through 2.0.13 and 2.2.x through 2.2.7, the WBXML
dissector could go into an infinite loop, triggered by packet
injection or a malformed capture file. This was addressed in
epan/dissectors/packet-wbxml.c by adding validation of the
relationships between indexes and lengths. NOTE: this vulnerability
exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-7702.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

Phase: Assigned(20170717)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=13755

In Wireshark through 2.0.13 and 2.2.x through 2.2.7, the openSAFETY
dissector could crash or exhaust system memory. This was addressed in
epan/dissectors/packet-opensafety.c by adding length validation. NOTE:
this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for
CVE-2017-9350.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1142
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161130)
Reference: BID:97081
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97081
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21998874

IBM Kenexa LCMS Premier on Cloud 9.x and 10.0 could allow a remote
attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the failure to set
the secure flag for the session cookie in SSL mode. By intercepting
its transmission within an HTTP session, an attacker could exploit
this vulnerability to capture the cookie and obtain sensitive
information. IBM Reference #: 1998874.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11420
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170718)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://asuswrt.lostrealm.ca/changelog
Reference: MISC:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/13/1

Stack-based buffer overflow in ASUS_Discovery.c in networkmap in
Asuswrt-Merlin firmware for ASUS devices and ASUS firmware for ASUS
RT-AC5300, RT_AC1900P, RT-AC68U, RT-AC68P, RT-AC88U, RT-AC66U, RT-
AC66U_B1, RT-AC58U, RT-AC56U, RT-AC55U, RT-AC52U, RT-AC51U, RT-N18U,
RT-N66U, RT-N56U, RT-AC3200, RT-AC3100, RT_AC1200GU, RT_AC1200G, RT-
AC1200, RT-AC53, RT-N12HP, RT-N12HP_B1, RT-N12D1, RT-N12+,
RT_N12+_PRO, RT-N16, and RT-N300 devices allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via long device information that is mishandled
during a strcat to a device list.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2017-11421
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170718)

Reference: MISC:http://news.dieweltistgarnichtso.net/posts/gnome-thumbnailer-msi-fail.html
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.debian.org/868705
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/gnome-exe-thumbnailer/gnome-exe-thumbnailer/commit/1d8e3102dd8fd23431ae6127d14a236da6b4a4a5

gnome-exe-thumbnailer before 0.9.5 is prone to a VBScript Injection
when generating thumbnails for MSI files, aka the "Bad Taste" issue.
There is a local attack if the victim uses the GNOME Files file
manager, and navigates to a directory containing a .msi file with
VBScript code in its filename.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11422
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170718)
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/rambo691/3714c8c09cf894d574d37c294711c49e

Statamic framework before 2.6.0 does not correctly check a session's
permissions when the methods from a user's class are called.
Problematic methods include reset password, create new account, create
new role, etc.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11423
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170718)
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3946
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3946
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201804-16
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201804-16
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.clamav.net/show_bug.cgi?id=11873
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/hackerlib/hackerlib-vul/tree/master/clamav-vul
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180212 [SECURITY] [DLA 1279-1] clamav security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/02/msg00014.html

The cabd_read_string function in mspack/cabd.c in libmspack 0.5alpha,
as used in ClamAV 0.99.2 and other products, allows remote attackers
to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer over-read and
application crash) via a crafted CAB file.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11424
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170718)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/jpadilla/pyjwt/pull/277
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3979
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2017/dsa-3979

In PyJWT 1.5.0 and below the `invalid_strings` check in
`HMACAlgorithm.prepare_key` does not account for all PEM encoded
public keys. Specifically, the PKCS1 PEM encoded format would be
allowed because it is prefaced with the string `-----BEGIN RSA PUBLIC
KEY-----` which is not accounted for. This enables
symmetric/asymmetric key confusion attacks against users using the
PKCS1 PEM encoded public keys, which would allow an attacker to craft
JWTs from scratch.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned(20170718)

Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1472611
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3925

Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180906 [SECURITY] [DLA 1497-1] qemu security update

Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/19/2
Reference: MLIST:[qemu-devel] 20170717 [PATCH] slirp: check len against dhcp options array end
Reference: URL:https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2017-07/msg05001.html

The dhcp_decode function in slirp/bootp.c in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator)
allows local guest OS users to cause a denial of service (out-of-
bounds read and QEMU process crash) via a crafted DHCP options string.


Current Votes:

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11435
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)
Reference: MISC:https://www.trustwave.com/Resources/Security-Advisories/Advisories/Multiple-Vulnerabilities-in-Humax-Routers/?fid=9700

The Humax Wi-Fi Router model HG100R-* 2.0.6 is prone to an
authentication bypass vulnerability via specially crafted requests to
the management console. The bug is exploitable remotely when the
router is configured to expose the management console. The router is
not validating the session token while returning answers for some
methods in url '/api'. An attacker can use this vulnerability to
retrieve sensitive information such as private/public IP addresses,
SSID names, and passwords.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://community.ivanti.com/docs/DOC-66252
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/lazyhack3r/439e92419c552b5dc82b2f5e832c8bfb

In Ivanti Service Desk (formerly LANDESK Management Suite) versions
between 2016.3 and 2017.3, an Unrestricted Direct Object Reference
leads to referencing/updating objects belonging to other users. In
other words, a normal user can send requests to a specific URI with
the target user's username in an HTTP payload in order to retrieve a
key/token and use it to access/update objects belonging to other
users. Such objects could be user profiles, tickets, incidents, etc.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11464
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)
Reference: BID:99956
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99956
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=783835
Reference: CONFIRM:https://git.gnome.org/browse/librsvg/commit/?id=ecf9267a24b2c3c0cd211dbdfa9ef2232511972a

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4436-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4436-1/

A SIGFPE is raised in the function box_blur_line of rsvg-filter.c in
GNOME librsvg 2.40.17 during an attempted parse of a crafted SVG file,
because of incorrect protection against division by zero.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11465
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/13742
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/projects/ruby-trunk/repository/revisions/59344

The parser_yyerror function in the UTF-8 parser in Ruby 2.4.1 allows
attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid write or read) or
possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted Ruby script,
related to the parser_tokadd_utf8 function in parse.y. NOTE: this
might have security relevance as a bypass of a $SAFE protection
mechanism.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11466
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/33
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/dotCMS/core/issues/12131
Reference: MISC:https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/143383/dotcms411-shell.txt

Arbitrary file upload vulnerability in
com/dotmarketing/servlets/AjaxFileUploadServlet.class in dotCMS 4.1.1
allows remote authenticated administrators to upload .jsp files to
arbitrary locations via directory traversal sequences in the fieldName
parameter to servlets/ajax_file_upload. This results in arbitrary code
execution by requesting the .jsp file at a /assets URI.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11467
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/orientechnologies/orientdb/wiki/OrientDB-2.2-Release-Notes#2223---july-11-2017

OrientDB through 2.2.22 does not enforce privilege requirements during
"where" or "fetchplan" or "order by" use, which allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands via a crafted request.

Docker Registry before 2.6.2 in Docker Distribution does not properly
restrict the amount of content accepted from a user, which allows
remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via
the manifest endpoint.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11472
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170719)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=3b2d69114fefa474fca542e51119036dceb4aa6f
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/acpica/acpica/commit/a23325b2e583556eae88ed3f764e457786bf4df6
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/3b2d69114fefa474fca542e51119036dceb4aa6f
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3619-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3619-1/
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3619-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3619-2/
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3754-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3754-1/

The acpi_ns_terminate() function in drivers/acpi/acpica/nsutils.c in
the Linux kernel before 4.12 does not flush the operand cache and
causes a kernel stack dump, which allows local users to obtain
sensitive information from kernel memory and bypass the KASLR
protection mechanism (in the kernel through 4.9) via a crafted ACPI
table.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Buffer overflow in the mp_override_legacy_irq() function in
arch/x86/kernel/acpi/boot.c in the Linux kernel through 3.2 allows
local users to gain privileges via a crafted ACPI table.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11480
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170720)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://discuss.elastic.co/t/beats-5-6-4-security-update/106739

Packetbeat versions prior to 5.6.4 are affected by a denial of service
flaw in the PostgreSQL protocol handler. If Packetbeat is listening
for PostgreSQL traffic and a user is able to send arbitrary network
traffic to the monitored port, the attacker could prevent Packetbeat
from properly logging other PostgreSQL traffic.

======================================================

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170720)
Reference: BID:102739

Reference: BID:102906
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102906

via a language pack (ZIP file) with invalid HTML files.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11499
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170720)
Reference: BID:99959
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99959
Reference: CONFIRM:https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/july-2017-security-releases/
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:2908
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2908
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2017:3002
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:3002

Node.js v4.0 through v4.8.3, all versions of v5.x, v6.0 through
v6.11.0, v7.0 through v7.10.0, and v8.0 through v8.1.3 was susceptible
to hash flooding remote DoS attacks as the HashTable seed was constant
across a given released version of Node.js. This was a result of
building with V8 snapshots enabled by default which caused the
initially randomized seed to be overwritten on startup.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

view. IBM Reference #: 1999515.

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170720)
Reference: MISC:http://blackwolfsec.cc/2017/07/20/Metinfo-directory-traversal-bypass/

A directory traversal vulnerability exists in MetInfo 5.3.17. A remote

parameter to /admin/system/database/filedown.php.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11501
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170720)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/20/1
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/27506
Reference: CONFIRM:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/nix-security-announce/qrDU0KH_ZRk

NixOS 17.03 and earlier has an unintended default absence of SSL
Certificate Validation for LDAP. The users.ldap NixOS module
implements user authentication against LDAP servers via a PAM module.
It was found that if TLS is enabled to connect to the LDAP server with
users.ldap.useTLS, peer verification will be unconditionally disabled
in /etc/ldap.conf.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11502
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170720)
Reference: MISC:https://blogs.securiteam.com/index.php/archives/2911#more-2911

Technicolor DPC3928AD DOCSIS devices allow remote attackers to read
arbitrary files via a request starting with "GET /../" on TCP port
4321.

Name: CVE-2017-11507
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170721)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://mathias-kettner.com/check_mk_werks.php?werk_id=7661
Reference: MISC:https://www.tenable.com/security/research/tra-2017-20

A cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Check_MK versions
1.2.8x prior to 1.2.8p25 and 1.4.0x prior to 1.4.0p9, allowing an
unauthenticated attacker to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via
the output_format parameter, and the username parameter of failed HTTP
basic authentication attempts, which is returned unencoded in an
internal server error page.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11508
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170721)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2017-13
Reference: SECTRACK:1039804
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039804

SecurityCenter versions 5.5.0, 5.5.1 and 5.5.2 contain a SQL Injection
vulnerability that could be exploited by an authenticated user with
sufficient privileges to run diagnostic scans. An attacker could
exploit this vulnerability by entering a crafted SQL query into the
password field of a diagnostic scan within SecurityCenter. Successful
exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to gain
unauthorized access.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11560
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170722)
Reference: MISC:http://manageengine.com
Reference: MISC:http://opmanager.com
Reference: MISC:https://www.trustwave.com/en-us/resources/security-resources/security-advisories/?fid=18736

An issue was discovered in ZOHO ManageEngine OpManager 12.2. By adding
a Google Map to the application, an authenticated user can upload an
HTML file. This HTML file is then rendered in various locations of the
application. JavaScript inside the uploaded HTML is also interpreted
by the application. Thus, an attacker can inject a malicious
JavaScript payload inside the HTML file and upload it to the
application.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11563
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170722)
Reference: FULLDISC:20180821 CVE-2017-11563: Remote Code Execution via stack overflow in D-Link EyeOn Baby Monitor (DCS-825L)
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2018/Aug/18
Reference: MISC:https://documents.trendmicro.com/assets/tech_brief_Device_Vulnerabilities_in_the_Connected_Home2.pdf

D-Link EyeOn Baby Monitor (DCS-825L) 1.08.1 has a remote code
execution vulnerability. A UDP "Discover" service, which provides
multiple functions such as changing the passwords and getting basic
information, was installed on the device. A remote attacker can send a
crafted UDP request to finderd to perform stack overflow and execute
arbitrary code with root privilege on the device.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11565
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170723)
Reference: BID:99933
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99933
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugs.debian.org/869153

debian/tor.init in the Debian tor_0.2.9.11-1~deb9u1 package for Tor
was designed to execute aa-exec from the standard system pathname if
the apparmor package is installed, but implements this incorrectly
(with a wrong assumption that the specific pathname would remain the
same forever), which allows attackers to bypass intended AppArmor
restrictions by leveraging the silent loss of this protection
mechanism. NOTE: this does not affect systems, such as default Debian
stretch installations, on which Tor startup relies on a systemd unit
file (instead of this tor.init script).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11578
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170723)
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20190609 Newly releases IoT security issues
Reference: URL:https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Jun/8
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153225/Blipcare-Clear-Text-Communication-Memory-Corruption.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ethanhunnt/IoT_vulnerabilities/blob/master/Blipcare_sec_issues.pdf

It was discovered as a part of the research on IoT devices in the most
recent firmware for Blipcare device that the device allows to connect
to web management interface on a non-SSL connection using plain text
HTTP protocol. The user uses the web management interface of the
device to provide the user's Wi-Fi credentials so that the device can
connect to it and have Internet access. This device acts as a Wireless
Blood pressure monitor and is used to measure blood pressure levels of
a person. This allows an attacker who is connected to the Blipcare's
device wireless network to easily sniff these values using a MITM
attack.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11579
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170723)
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20190609 Newly releases IoT security issues
Reference: URL:https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Jun/8
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153225/Blipcare-Clear-Text-Communication-Memory-Corruption.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ethanhunnt/IoT_vulnerabilities/blob/master/Blipcare_sec_issues.pdf

In the most recent firmware for Blipcare, the device provides an open
Wireless network called "Blip" for communicating with the device. The
user connects to this open Wireless network and uses the web
management interface of the device to provide the user's Wi-Fi
credentials so that the device can connect to it and have Internet
access. This device acts as a Wireless Blood pressure monitor and is
used to measure blood pressure levels of a person. This allows an
attacker who is in vicinity of Wireless signal generated by the
Blipcare device to easily sniff the credentials. Also, an attacker can
connect to the open wireless network "Blip" exposed by the device and
modify the HTTP response presented to the user by the device to
execute other attacks such as convincing the user to download and
execute a malicious binary that would infect a user's computer or
mobile device with malware.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1158
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161130)

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11580
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170723)
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20190609 Newly releases IoT security issues
Reference: URL:https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Jun/8
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153225/Blipcare-Clear-Text-Communication-Memory-Corruption.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ethanhunnt/IoT_vulnerabilities/blob/master/Blipcare_sec_issues.pdf

Blipcare Wifi blood pressure monitor BP700 10.1 devices allow memory
corruption that results in Denial of Service. When connected to the
"Blip" open wireless connection provided by the device, if a large
string is sent as a part of the HTTP request in any part of the HTTP
headers, the device could become completely unresponsive. Presumably
this happens as the memory footprint provided to this device is very
small. According to the specs from Rezolt, the Wi-Fi module only has
256k of memory. As a result, an incorrect string copy operation using
either memcpy, strcpy, or any of their other variants could result in
filling up the memory space allocated to the function executing and
this would result in memory corruption. To test the theory, one can
modify the demo application provided by the Cypress WICED SDK and
introduce an incorrect "memcpy" operation and use the compiled
application on the evaluation board provided by Cypress semiconductors
with exactly the same Wi-Fi SOC. The results were identical where the
device would completely stop responding to any of the ping or web
requests.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11581
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170723)
Reference: MISC:http://lorexxar.cn/2017/07/20/FineCMS%20multi%20vulnerablity%20before%20v5.0.9/#Reflected-XSS

via a payload in the username field that does not begin with a '<'
character.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11584
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170723)
Reference: MISC:http://lorexxar.cn/2017/07/20/FineCMS%20multi%20vulnerablity%20before%20v5.0.9/#SQL-injection-via-system-field-parameter

action=module, action=member, action=form, or action=related request
to libraries/Template.php.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

IBM Business Process Manager 8.0 and 8.5 could allow a remote attacker
to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By
persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote
attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed
to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be
trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive
information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force
ID: 122891.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11611
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170724)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/faizzaidi/Wolfcms-v0.8.3.1-xss-POC-by-Provensec-llc

Wolf CMS 0.8.3.1 allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The
vulnerability exists due to insufficient sanitization of the file name
in a "create-file-popup" action, and the directory name in a "create-
directory-popup" action, in the HTTP POST method to the
"/plugin/file_manager/" script (aka an
/admin/plugin/file_manager/browse// URI).

Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11613
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: BID:99977
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99977
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4349
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4349
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/dazhouzhou/1a3b7400547f23fe316db303ab9b604f
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180531 [SECURITY] [DLA 1391-1] tiff security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/05/msg00022.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180702 [SECURITY] [DLA 1411-1] tiff security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/07/msg00002.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3606-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3606-1/

In LibTIFF 4.0.8, there is a denial of service vulnerability in the
TIFFOpen function. A crafted input will lead to a denial of service
attack. During the TIFFOpen process, td_imagelength is not checked.
The value of td_imagelength can be directly controlled by an input
file. In the ChopUpSingleUncompressedStrip function, the
_TIFFCheckMalloc function is called based on td_imagelength. If we set
the value of td_imagelength close to the amount of system memory, it
will hang the system or trigger the OOM killer.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11614
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/59

MEDHOST Connex contains hard-coded credentials that are used for
customer database access. An attacker with knowledge of the hard-coded
credentials and the ability to communicate directly with the database
may be able to obtain or modify sensitive patient and financial
information. Connex utilizes an IBM i DB2 user account for database
access. The account name is HMSCXPDN. Its password is hard-coded in
multiple places in the application. Customers do not have the option
to change this password. The account has elevated DB2 roles, and can
access all objects or database tables on the customer DB2 database.
This account can access data through ODBC, FTP, and TELNET. Customers
without Connex installed are still vulnerable because the MEDHOST
setup program creates this account.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:https://security.gerhardt.link/RCE-in-Factorio/

A sandbox escape in the Lua interface in Wube Factorio before 0.15.31
allows remote game servers or user-assisted attackers to execute
arbitrary C code by including and loading a C library.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11624
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:http://somevulnsofadlab.blogspot.jp/2017/07/qpdfan-infinite-loop-in-libqpdf.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/qpdf/qpdf/issues/117
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3638-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3638-1/

A stack-consumption vulnerability was found in libqpdf in QPDF 6.0.0,
which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted
file, related to the QPDFTokenizer::resolveLiteral function in
QPDFTokenizer.cc after two consecutive calls to
QPDFObjectHandle::parseInternal, aka an "infinite loop."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11625
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:http://somevulnsofadlab.blogspot.jp/2017/07/qpdfan-infinite-loop-in-libqpdf_26.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/qpdf/qpdf/issues/120
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3638-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3638-1/

A stack-consumption vulnerability was found in libqpdf in QPDF 6.0.0,
which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted
file, related to the QPDF::resolveObjectsInStream function in QPDF.cc,
aka an "infinite loop."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11626
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:http://somevulnsofadlab.blogspot.jp/2017/07/qpdfan-infinite-loop-in-libqpdf_65.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/qpdf/qpdf/issues/119
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3638-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3638-1/

A stack-consumption vulnerability was found in libqpdf in QPDF 6.0.0,
which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted
file, related to the QPDFTokenizer::resolveLiteral function in
QPDFTokenizer.cc after four consecutive calls to
QPDFObjectHandle::parseInternal, aka an "infinite loop."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:http://somevulnsofadlab.blogspot.jp/2017/07/qpdfan-infinite-loop-in-libqpdf_21.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/qpdf/qpdf/issues/118
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-3638-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/3638-1/

A stack-consumption vulnerability was found in libqpdf in QPDF 6.0.0,
which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted
file, related to the PointerHolder function in PointerHolder.hh, aka
an "infinite loop."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11628
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: BID:99489
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99489
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20180112-0001/
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4080
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4080
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4081
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4081
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201709-21
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201709-21
Reference: MISC:http://git.php.net/?p=php-src.git;a=commit;h=05255749139b3686c8a6a58ee01131ac0047465e
Reference: MISC:http://git.php.net/?p=php-src.git;a=commit;h=5f8380d33e648964d2d5140f329cf2d4c443033c
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=74603
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:1296
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1296

In PHP before 5.6.31, 7.x before 7.0.21, and 7.1.x before 7.1.7, a
stack-based buffer overflow in the zend_ini_do_op() function in
Zend/zend_ini_parser.c could cause a denial of service or potentially
allow executing code. NOTE: this is only relevant for PHP applications
that accept untrusted input (instead of the system's php.ini file) for
the parse_ini_string or parse_ini_file function, e.g., a web
application for syntax validation of php.ini directives.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11634
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170725)
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/eloygn/IT_Security_Research_WirelessIP_camera_family

An issue was discovered on Wireless IP Camera 360 devices. Remote
attackers can discover a weakly encoded admin password by connecting
to TCP port 9527 and reading the password field of the debugging
information, e.g., nTBCS19C corresponds to a password of 123456.

Name: CVE-2017-11654

Reference: BID:100023
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100023

An out-of-bounds read and write flaw was found in the way SIPcrack 0.2
processed SIP traffic, because 0x00 termination of a payload array was
mishandled. A remote attacker could potentially use this flaw to crash
the sipdump process by generating specially crafted SIP traffic.

SIP traffic, because a lines array was mismanaged. A remote attacker
could potentially use this flaw to crash long-running sipdump network

Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3957

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/ffcc82219cef0928bed2d558b19ef6ea35634130

The ff_amf_get_field_value function in libavformat/rtmppkt.c in FFmpeg
3.3.2 allows remote RTMP servers to cause a denial of service
(Segmentation Violation and application crash) via a crafted stream.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

by generating specially crafted network traffic.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11671
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170726)
Reference: BID:100018
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100018
Reference: CONFIRM:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/27/2
Reference: CONFIRM:https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=80180
Reference: CONFIRM:https://gcc.gnu.org/ml/gcc-patches/2017-03/msg01349.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2018:0849
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0849

Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in
i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5
before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that
clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it
can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go
unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random
number generation.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11693
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170727)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/71

MEDHOST Document Management System contains hard-coded credentials
that are used for customer database access. An attacker with knowledge
of the hard-coded credentials and the ability to communicate directly
with the database may be able to obtain or modify sensitive patient
and financial information. PostgreSQL is used as the Document
Management System database. The account name is dms. The password is
hard-coded throughout the application, and is the same across all
installations. Customers do not have the option to change passwords.
The dms account for PostgreSQL has access to the database schema for
Document Management System.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11694
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170727)
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/71

MEDHOST Document Management System contains hard-coded credentials
that are used for Apache Solr access. An attacker with knowledge of
the hard-coded credentials and the ability to communicate directly
with Apache Solr may be able to obtain or modify sensitive patient and
financial information. The Apache Solr account name is dms. The
password is hard-coded throughout the application, and is the same
across all installations. Customers do not have the option to change
passwords. The dms account for Apache Solr has access to all indexed
patient documents.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11722
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170728)
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4321
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4321
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2019-425a1aa7c9
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WHIKB4TP6KBJWT2UIPWL5MWMG5QXKGEJ/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2019-da4c20882c
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/PF62B5PJA2JDUOCKJGUQO3SPL74BEYSV/
Reference: MISC:http://hg.code.sf.net/p/graphicsmagick/code/rev/f423ba88ca4e

The WriteOnePNGImage function in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds
read and application crash) via a crafted file, because the program's
actual control flow was inconsistent with its indentation. This
resulted in a logging statement executing outside of a loop, and
consequently using an invalid array index corresponding to the loop's
exit condition.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11739
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170729)
Reference: BID:108469
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108469
Reference: MISC:http://application.com
Reference: MISC:http://manageengine.com
Reference: MISC:https://www.trustwave.com/en-us/resources/security-resources/security-advisories/?fid=18734

In Zoho ManageEngine Application Manager 13.1 Build 13100, an
authenticated user, with administrative privileges, has the ability to
add a widget on any dashboard. This widget can be a "Utility Widget"
with a "Custom HTML or Text" field. Once this widget is created, it
will be loaded on the dashboard where it was added. An attacker can
abuse this functionality by creating a "Utility Widget" that contains
malicious JavaScript code, aka XSS.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11743
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170730)
Reference: BID:100086
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100086
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2017/Jul/75

MEDHOST Connex contains a hard-coded Mirth Connect admin credential
that is used for customer Mirth Connect management access. An attacker
with knowledge of the hard-coded credential and the ability to
communicate directly with the Mirth Connect management console may be
able to intercept sensitive patient information. The admin account
password is hard-coded as $K8t1ng throughout the application, and is
the same across all installations. Customers do not have the option to
change the Mirth Connect admin account password. The Mirth Connect
admin account is created during the Connex install. The plaintext
account password is hard-coded multiple times in the Connex install
and update scripts.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

System Settings module are vulnerable to XSS. A malicious payload sent
to connectors/index.php will be triggered by every user, when they
visit this module.

and 7.0.6-4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL
pointer dereference) via a crafted file.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

In Earcms Ear Music through 4.1 build 20170710, remote authenticated

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11757
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: MISC:http://supportservices.actian.com/support-services/security-center#announcements
Reference: MISC:https://blogs.securiteam.com/index.php/archives/2924
Reference: MISC:https://twitter.com/SecuriTeam_SSD/status/815567538318954496

Heap-based buffer overflow in Actian Pervasive PSQL v12.10 and Zen v13
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted traffic
to TCP port 1583. The overflow occurs after Server-Client encryption-
key exchange. The issue results from an integer underflow that leads
to a zero-byte allocation. The _srvLnaConnectMP1 function is affected.

reused elsewhere, due to how Skype for Business handles authentication
requests, aka "Skype for Business Elevation of Privilege
Vulnerability."

CVE-2017-11873.

When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-11918
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: BID:102089
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102089
Reference: CONFIRM:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-11918
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:43469
Reference: URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43469/
Reference: SECTRACK:1039990
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039990

ChakraCore and Microsoft Edge in Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703,
1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to gain the same user
rights as the current user, due to how the scripting engine handles
objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption
Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11886,
CVE-2017-11889, CVE-2017-11890, CVE-2017-11893, CVE-2017-11894,
CVE-2017-11895, CVE-2017-11901, CVE-2017-11903, CVE-2017-11905,
CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11907, CVE-2017-11908, CVE-2017-11909,
CVE-2017-11910, CVE-2017-11911, CVE-2017-11912, CVE-2017-11913,
CVE-2017-11914, CVE-2017-11916, and CVE-2017-11930.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102093

ChakraCore, and Internet Explorer in Microsoft Windows 7 SP1, Windows

2012 R2, and Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, Windows Server
2016, and Microsoft Edge in Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709,
and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to obtain information to
further compromise the user's system, due to how the scripting engine
handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Information
Disclosure Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11887
and CVE-2017-11906.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1195
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161130)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg22007160
Reference: MISC:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/123670

IBM Curam Social Program Management 6.0, 6.1, 6.2, and 7.0 could allow
a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect
attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site,
a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL
displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear
to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly
sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim.
IBM X-Force ID: 123670.

Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg22004170
Reference: MISC:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/123672

IBM BigFix Compliance (TEMA SUAv1 SCA SCM) uses an inadequate account
lockout setting that could allow a remote attacker to brute force
account credentials. IBM X-Force ID: 123672.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: CONFIRM:https://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=ibm10737581

sensitive information in URL parameters. This may lead to information
disclosure if unauthorized parties have access to the URLs via server
logs, referrer header or browser history. IBM X-Force ID: 123673.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1199
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161130)
Reference: BID:100129
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100129
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg22006618
Reference: MISC:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/123674

IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management Server 10.0, 11.0, 11.3, 11.4,
11.5, and 11.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This
vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the
Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to
credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID:
123674.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-1200
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20161130)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=ibm10737581
Reference: XF:ibm-bigfix-cve20171200-info-disc(123675)
Reference: URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/123675

IBM BigFix Compliance 1.7 through 1.9.91 (TEMA SUAv1 SCA SCM) does not
validate, or incorrectly validates, a certificate.This weakness might
allow an attacker to spoof a trusted entity by using a man-in-the-
middle (MITM) attack. The software might connect to a malicious host
while believing it is a trusted host, or the software might be
deceived into accepting spoofed data that appears to originate from a
trusted host. IBM X-Force ID: 123675.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

vulnerable to HTML injection. A remote attacker could inject malicious
HTML code, which when viewed, would be executed in the victim's Web
browser within the security context of the hosting site. IBM X-Force
ID: 123677.

When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12061
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/08/01/1
Reference: CONFIRM:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/08/01/2
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/commit/17f9b94f031ba93ae2a727bca0e68458ecd08fb0
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/commit/c73ae3d3d4dd4681489a9e697e8ade785e27cba5
Reference: CONFIRM:https://mantisbt.org/bugs/view.php?id=23146
Reference: SECTRACK:1039030
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039030

An XSS issue was discovered in admin/install.php in MantisBT before
1.3.12 and 2.x before 2.5.2. Some variables under user control in the
MantisBT installation script are not properly sanitized before being
output, allowing remote attackers to inject arbitrary JavaScript code,
as demonstrated by the $f_database, $f_db_username, and
$f_admin_username variables. This is mitigated by the fact that the
admin/ folder should be deleted after installation, and also prevented
by CSP.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12062
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/08/01/1
Reference: CONFIRM:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/08/01/2
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/commit/9b5b71dadbeeeec27efea59f562ac5bd6d2673b7
Reference: CONFIRM:https://mantisbt.org/bugs/view.php?id=23166
Reference: SECTRACK:1039030
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039030

An XSS issue was discovered in manage_user_page.php in MantisBT 2.x
before 2.5.2. The 'filter' field is not sanitized before being
rendered in the Manage User page, allowing remote attackers to execute
arbitrary JavaScript code if CSP is disabled.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12066
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: CONFIRM:https://cacti.net/release_notes.php?version=1.1.16
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/commit/bd0e586f6f46d814930226f1516a194e7e72293e
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/issues/877

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in aggregate_graphs.php in
Cacti before 1.1.16 allows remote authenticated users to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML via specially crafted HTTP Referer
headers, related to the $cancel_url variable. NOTE: this vulnerability
exists because of an incomplete fix (lack of the htmlspecialchars
ENT_QUOTES flag) for CVE-2017-11163.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12069
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: BID:100559
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100559
Reference: CONFIRM:https://opcfoundation-onlineapplications.org/faq/SecurityBulletins/OPC_Foundation_Security_Bulletin_CVE-2017-12069.pdf
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-535640.pdf
Reference: SECTRACK:1039510
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039510

An XXE vulnerability has been identified in OPC Foundation UA .NET
Sample Code before 2017-03-21 and Local Discovery Server (LDS) before
1.03.367. Among the affected products are Siemens SIMATIC PCS7 (All
versions V8.1 and earlier), SIMATIC WinCC (All versions < V7.4 SP1),
SIMATIC WinCC Runtime Professional (All versions < V14 SP1), SIMATIC
NET PC Software, and SIMATIC IT Production Suite. By sending specially
crafted packets to the OPC Discovery Server at port 4840/tcp, an
attacker might cause the system to access various resources chosen by
the attacker.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12081
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4248
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4248
Reference: MISC:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0433
Reference: URL:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0433
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180813 [SECURITY] [DLA 1465-1] blender security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/08/msg00011.html

An exploitable integer overflow exists in the upgrade of a legacy Mesh
attribute of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite v2.78c. A
specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting
in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the
context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to open
the file or use it as a library in order to trigger this
vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12082
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4248
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4248
Reference: MISC:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0434
Reference: URL:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0434
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180813 [SECURITY] [DLA 1465-1] blender security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/08/msg00011.html

An exploitable integer overflow exists in the 'CustomData' Mesh
loading functionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite. A
.blend file with a specially crafted external data file can cause an
integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for
code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can
convince a user to edit an object within a .blend library in their
Scene in order to trigger this vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12083
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: MISC:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0435
Reference: URL:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0435

An exploitable information disclosure vulnerability exists in the apid
daemon of the Circle with Disney running firmware 2.0.1. A specially
crafted set of packets can make the Disney Circle dump strings from an
internal database into an HTTP response. An attacker needs network
connectivity to the Internet to trigger this vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12084
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: MISC:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0436
Reference: URL:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0436

A backdoor vulnerability exists in remote control functionality of
Circle with Disney running firmware 2.0.1. A specific set of network
packets can remotely start an SSH server on the device, resulting in a
persistent backdoor. An attacker can send an API call to enable the
SSH server.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12085
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: MISC:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0437
Reference: URL:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0437

An exploitable routing vulnerability exists in the Circle with Disney
cloud infrastructure. A specially crafted packet can make the Circle
cloud route a packet to any arbitrary Circle device. An attacker needs
network connectivity to the Internet to trigger this vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2017-12086
Status: Candidate
Phase: Assigned(20170731)
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4248
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4248
Reference: MISC:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0438
Reference: URL:https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0438
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20180813 [SECURITY] [DLA 1465-1] blender security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/08/msg00011.html

An exploitable integer overflow exists in the
'BKE_mesh_calc_normals_tessface' functionality of the Blender open-
source 3d creation suite. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an
integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for
code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can
convince a user to open a .blend file in order to trigger this
vulnerability.

v2.78c. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow
resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution
under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user
to open the file or use it as a library in order to trigger this
vulnerability.
